missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode1_Mission1

encounter.locDescription: Trapped on an alien vessel, Burnham is forced to engage in combat with an unknown enemy.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Thanks for responding to my distress call!
I don't know where I am or how I got here, but the locals aren't very friendly!
Destroy the intruder!

missions.locDescription: After a successful leap into the Nexus, the U.S.S. Artemis comes under fire from an unknown enemy.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode1_Mission2

encounter.locDescription: A surprising ally joins the team and aids Burnham in her search for the engine room.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Good to see-- Wait, a Klingon in a Starfleet uniform?!
You would mock a fellow officer?
I’m just glad you’re on my side!
Cardassian technology is no more advanced than Starfleet’s. We should be able to disable their warp core easily.
What’s a “Cardassian”?

encounter.locDescription: Cardassian soldiers advance on the team. Perhaps combat isn't the only way to surpass the enemy.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Artemis, we’re ready to beam out of here!
The Cardassians are attempting to block our signals. We must hold them off until we can safely transport!

missions.locDescription: Before Commander Burnham can leave the unknown vessel, its warp core must be disabled.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode1_Mission3

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm picking up life signs around the base. Energy readings show traces of an attack. Could be the Cardassians.
Any sign of Starfleet crew out there?
Not yet. Atmospheric ionization could be blocking a precise reading from our tricorders.
We should prepare for battle. The Cardassians will NOT show mercy.
I’ve located supplies. It seems they were left behind by the Cardassians.
Why, that’s Protomatter! We can use that to upgrade or unlock new Skills.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Cardassians!
You... You're not real! You’re ghosts, like the others!
Are all you Cardassians this paranoid? Stand down and we’ll get you medical assistance.
We won’t fall for any more of your Federation tricks. Fire at will!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I am Gul Dukat, commander of the Cardassian forces stationed here. We will not fall prey to any more deception!
I declare this base and its personnel to be property of the Cardassian Union. You specters will not stand in my way!
Surrender your weapons or be destroyed!
Klingons do NOT surrender!
As you wish. Soldiers, weapons ready!
These bodies… Their wounds don’t look like they were caused by those Cardassian weapons.
Commander Burnham of the U.S.S. Discovery hailing Federation outpost, please respond! I repeat, this is Commander Burnham...
We must assume the worst. The Cardassians may have penetrated the facility’s defenses.
Let’s regroup on the Artemis and plan our next move.

missions.locDescription: The U.S.S. Artemis responds to a distress signal from an unknown Federation base.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode1_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Unknown personnel detected. Error. Memory circuit compromised.
Damned thing is going haywire. Looks like we’ll have to find our own way in.
I suggest we cut through the door. It is the most direct approach.
Or I can override the door’s security protocols. A more cautious approach might be better…
The Choices you make during missions can affect their outcomes, unlocking new rewards or alternate paths!

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Finally a friendly face! Can you tell us what’s happened here?
Hostile entities detected. Engaging countermeasures.
They are hardly friendly, Doctor!
I’m accessing the complex’s database. This is a research facility working on something named “Project Talos”.
That would explain the “ghosts”. These scientists must have been inspired by Talosian illusions. I’ve had first-hand experience with them. All too real.
As in Talos IV? But travel to that planet’s forbidden by Starfleet.
Blame Spock.
You know that aggravating Vulcan too?
It’s a long story.
Chief scientist’s personal log. We’ve made a breakthrough with Project Talos.
Exposing the central logic circuits to various threat scenarios has increased its combat effectiveness by 72.3%.
Talos, how are we doing today?
All systems are operating within 99.2% of normal parameters.
My staff has expressed ethical concerns about subjecting such an advanced artificial intelligence to repeated traumatic combat scenarios.
I have to remind them that it’s still a computer, not a human being, even considering our recent modifications. End recording.
I have located a storage chest, but I am having difficulty opening it...  This mechanism is most aggravating.
Don’t look at me. I’m a doctor, not a locksmith.
Let me take a look. I have a knack for this kind of thing…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Escalating threat level. Engaging intruders.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Security breach in sector A-23. Searching for countermeasures... Stand by.
Response found. Experience indicates a 96.32% chance of successful removal of intruders.
I recognize her. It is Captain Janeway of the U.S.S. Voyager!
Let us hope this imitation is not as formidable as the Captain herself.

missions.locDescription: With no reply from survivors within Federation Base, the away team must investigate the facility with caution.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode1_Mission5

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Deploying defensive countermeasures. Shields to full power.
They’ve got a mobile force field emitter protecting them!
I’ve found another terminal. The files have been partially deleted, but... this facility was run by Section 31!
Who the devil are they?
Section 31 is a clandestine group within Starfleet. They’re prepared to do anything to protect the Federation.
This base was testing a new form of tactical computer.
They discovered an experimental processor, capable of granting the device a more... human… response.
Hrm. That sounds suspiciously like an "emotion chip". It can have... unpredicatable results.
They were trying to use it to predict the behavior of biological life forms, creating a machine that knows how we think...
... then using that against us.
But what about the researchers that were here? Where are they now?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Thank you for opening the doors. We lay claim to this base for the Cardassian Union!
Stop firing at us, you idiots! We're flesh and blood, same as you!
I suggest conversing them AFTER we incapacitate them, Doctor.
We are near the central core. How should we proceed?
Looks like the left path leads to the medical bay. We might find some more bio-mimetic gel there.
I’ve found another terminal. The encryption is extremely secure… I don’t know if I’ll be able to hack it!
I’ve found another personnel log. Stand by...
Chief scientist’s personal log. Thanks to the new processor, we’re making extraordinary progress!
We’ve programmed Talos to create more realistic and unpredictable holograms.
But there have been concerns that the sheer amount of energy required has begun to destabilize some of the secondary systems.
There is no cause for alarm, chief scientist.
Such disruptions are well within the range of acceptable stress parameters. Our work together will proceed as planned.
... Thank you, Talos. End log.
Sounds like this “Talos” has a mind of its own...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: If this is a Starfleet program, it will be programmed to obey our orders.
Computer, this is Lieutenant Worf of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Cease all aggressive activity at once!
Command not accepted.  Primary protocol is protecting the central Core. Talos must survive.

missions.locDescription: Project TALOS' defenses have run amok, complicating the search for survivors within the base.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode1_Mission6

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We’re almost at the core. Be careful!
I am more than ready to end this.
I’ve found another personal log...
Emergency log. Talos is no longer following our commands.
A mysterious power surge in the core has Talos is stuck in a feedback loop.
It thinks our threat response scenarios are real. It’s trying to purge the base using the EDH programs!
I’ve sent out a distress signal, but I don’t know how much longer we can--
--Transmission terminated--
This blasted machine killed everyone! It can’t distinguish between a simulation and reality!
Operation parameters uncertain. Extreme measures taken to protect central core. Talos must survive.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stand down, Talos!
Hostile entities encountered. Upgrading threat level to epsilon-orange. Generating defensive measures.
You just had to go and irritate the damn thing...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hostile entities have accessed Core. Threat level at maximum. Searching files for counter. Searching... Searching...
Designation: Tactician required. Expert leadership required. Searching Starfleet files, sub-category: Commander.
I think it's trying to find someone strong enough to defeat us...
Result: William T. Riker, First Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Riker is a trusted friend. But we must remember that these are only holograms!
This machine is responsible for the death of everyone involved in its creation. It’s too dangerous. We’ve got to destroy it!
Perhaps…
But on MY Enterprise, Commander Data was an android with an intelligence matching that of Talos, and I was honored to call him my friend.
Talos seeks to preserve itself. Is that not a sign of sentience?
First a Klingon officer, now a robot? What’s gotten into Starfleet in the future?
This energy seems to be corrupting the system. If we purge it, we can restart Talos and give him a second chance.
Computer, what is the status of Project Talos?
There are no records of Project Talos in the Starfleet database.
Finally, a machine that will listen to us! It’s about time.
The system is coming back online. Here goes nothing...
System online. Identifying Starfleet personnel. Welcome to Talos Base, Doctor McCoy.
At least it’s learned some manners.
We’ll disable the distress call. You’ll be left alone for a long time, Talos.
System diagnostic in progress. Searching for new directives... Thank you for your assistance.
I’m reading a powerful energy source inside the machine…
Let me see... Ah! There’s some sort of device inside the housing!
Perhaps this is the experimental processor they mentioned?
I don’t know. I’ve never seen anything like it before.
Intriguing. The energy pouring out of it appears similar to the ribbon in space that trapped us here in the Nexus.
You’re right, man. Let's bring it back to the ship. With any luck it might tell us more about this damn dimension!

missions.locDescription: The computer core of Talos must be disabled at all costs, to prevent further loss of life.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: If this is a Starfleet program, it will be programmed to obey our orders.
Computer, this is Lieutenant Worf of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Cease all aggressive activity at once!
Command not accepted.  Primary protocol is protecting the central Core. Talos must survive.

missions.locDescription: Project TALOS' defenses have run amok, complicating the search for survivors within the base.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode1_Mission6

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We’re almost at the core. Be careful!
I am more than ready to end this.
I’ve found another personal log...
Emergency log. Talos is no longer following our commands.
A mysterious power surge in the core has Talos is stuck in a feedback loop.
It thinks our threat response scenarios are real. It’s trying to purge the base using the EDH programs!
I’ve sent out a distress signal, but I don’t know how much longer we can--
--Transmission terminated--
This blasted machine killed everyone! It can’t distinguish between a simulation and reality!
Operation parameters uncertain. Extreme measures taken to protect central core. Talos must survive.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stand down, Talos!
Hostile entities encountered. Upgrading threat level to epsilon-orange. Generating defensive measures.
You just had to go and irritate the damn thing...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hostile entities have accessed Core. Threat level at maximum. Searching files for counter. Searching... Searching...
Designation: Tactician required. Expert leadership required. Searching Starfleet files, sub-category: Commander.
I think it's trying to find someone strong enough to defeat us...
Result: William T. Riker, First Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Riker is a trusted friend. But we must remember that these are only holograms!
This machine is responsible for the death of everyone involved in its creation. It’s too dangerous. We’ve got to destroy it!
Perhaps…
But on MY Enterprise, Commander Data was an android with an intelligence matching that of Talos, and I was honored to call him my friend.
Talos seeks to preserve itself. Is that not a sign of sentience?
First a Klingon officer, now a robot? What’s gotten into Starfleet in the future?
This energy seems to be corrupting the system. If we purge it, we can restart Talos and give him a second chance.
Computer, what is the status of Project Talos?
There are no records of Project Talos in the Starfleet database.
Finally, a machine that will listen to us! It’s about time.
The system is coming back online. Here goes nothing...
System online. Identifying Starfleet personnel. Welcome to Talos Base, Doctor McCoy.
At least it’s learned some manners.
We’ll disable the distress call. You’ll be left alone for a long time, Talos.
System diagnostic in progress. Searching for new directives... Thank you for your assistance.
I’m reading a powerful energy source inside the machine…
Let me see... Ah! There’s some sort of device inside the housing!
Perhaps this is the experimental processor they mentioned?
I don’t know. I’ve never seen anything like it before.
Intriguing. The energy pouring out of it appears similar to the ribbon in space that trapped us here in the Nexus.
You’re right, man. Let's bring it back to the ship. With any luck it might tell us more about this damn dimension!

missions.locDescription: The computer core of Talos must be disabled at all costs, to prevent further loss of life.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ah, Doctor McCoy. A pleasure to hear your voice. And you as well, Michael, after all this time.
Wait...  you two know each other? How?
A story for another time. Unfortunately, Captain Kirk is missing. The shuttle he was aboard has vanished.
Long range scans detect a Federation distress signal on Trigon VII, the planet you are orbiting... It could be from the captain.
Your assistance in locating him would be appreciated. Enterprise out.
Was that really him? Was it Spock?
No… His resonance signature is consistent with the Nexus. The real Spock is still out there, somewhere…
Then he is no more than a phantom. Still, we do not know if the Kirk he described is real or not. We should investigate.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Have you found the human whose signal we intercepted?
No. The commander won’t be pleased. Wait.. Over there! Federation dogs!
The commander will be happier when we bring her prisoners of war! Weapons ready!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: My tricorder shows a storm blowing in. We’d better move quickly.
How do you know Spock, anyway? Were you students together at the Vulcan science academy?
We're siblings, Doctor. And before you ask, I was adopted.
Hmphh. You do seem a little green-blooded…
I’m detecting a Starfleet beacon from within that shuttle...
No sign of Jim. He must still be out there. We should check the shuttlecraft’s logs.
We should proceed with caution and scan the area. There may be more Romulans cloaked nearby.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stop! This is as far as you go.
What have you done with Captain Kirk?
The captain is in very good hands. But it is a pity you’ll never see him again.

missions.locDescription: The U.S.S Artemis recieves a message from Starfleet - Captain Kirk has vanished.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission2

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: You fools run blindly toward your deaths!
Empty words from a coward’s mouth! To battle!
Sub-commander, what is your status? Respond!
Sela! You bring dishonor to the name of Tasha Yar.
I'm working for the good of my people. I haven’t betrayed them, like you have.
You fool! You’re trapped in this “Nexus” just like we are!
“Nexus”? What nonsense is this?
She doesn’t know… What if she’s part of this place?
Enough of this. Where is Captain Kirk?
If you value your lives, you will forget your captain!
Farewell. I can’t imagine we’ll meet again.
A Romulan encampment, hastily abandoned. We should search it for clues to Kirk’s location.
That device over there looks like a comms unit. I’ll try to hack it’s logs…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We’ll need to subdue these Romulans before they warn Sela of our approach!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: You again? I’m surprised you were able to sneak up on our position.
How positively Romulan of you!
You won’t get away this! Hand over Captain Kirk!
Should I be threatened by a doctor?
Your self-righteousness bores me. Let’s get this over with.

missions.locDescription: The hunt for Kirk brings the away team into conflict with Romulan mercenaries.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission3

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: What is that?!
You wouldn’t have met one yet, but Jim Kirk did. They’re called the Gorn.
Drazz'tak norshgrrz!
It seems the universal translator is having difficulty with the Gorn language...
He is challenging us to battle! Prepare yourselves!
I'm picking up a Romulan transmission originating nearby
It must be the unit escorting Captain Kirk
Maybe... let me see if I can intercept the signal.
... proceed to the designated location. We look forward to meeting with your ambassador in person.
Be wary of… pests that may interfere with our meeting. Tomalak out.
That is Tomalak, a Romulan Commander. My Enterprise has had several encounters with him.
He is duplicitous, and will stop at nothing to meet his goal.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I have found a piece of Romulan technology. It seems to be the source of the transmissions.
I might be able to access it and replay more of their communications.
I’m picking up Gorn life-signs over that ridge. They might lead us to Jim.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Commander Tomalak has ordered you eliminated, Federation pests.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Commander Tomalak, the meeting with the Gorn delegates commences as planned.
Are we really forging an alliance with these brutes?
My dear sub-commander, you shouldn’t be unkind to our hosts.
After all, they will be on the front line when we expand into Federation space.
Brilliant, Commander. What of the Federation spies we’ve detected?
Dispose of them quietly. They must not interfere with our meeting.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Just ahead… Keep your voices down. There's something happening.
“Something” is right. I see Romulans AND Gorn.
...we’ve made good on our promise to deliver Kirk. Now... Do we have your support?
<The Nest Father appreciates your gift as he approaches the great shedding.>
It’s using a translator device. I’m surprised the Gorn have a tool meant for diplomacy.
<The One known as Kirk is on his way to the Nest Father's base. But...>
<Before we speak further… I assume the Federation troops stalking behind those rocks aren't your allies…>
My apologies. We will see to this intrusion.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

missions.locDescription: The team uncover evidence of a far reaching plot to create an alliance between the Romulans and the Gorn.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Captain Kirk must be nearby. But among these rocks... it's like finding a needle in the proverbial haystack.
Can you try tracking his communicator? He might have managed to hide it when he was captured.
It's working! He's close!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: What on earth happened to them?
It's Jim! Jim happened to them.
We should scan the area to see which way he went.
One of the Gorn is still alive. Perhaps he will have knowledge of Captain Kirk.
I’m no herpetologist, Mr. Worf, but maybe there’s something I can do for him.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So the Gorn brought you here as well? You’ll hand over your equipment, or we’ll take it from you.
We’re hardly prisoners. We’re here for my friend!
First one to bring down the Klingon gets his bat'leth!
Jim! Is that you, man?
Bones! I’ve never been happier to see you!
But what on earth are you doing here? Who are your friends?
Commander Burnham of the U.S.S. Discovery. It’s a pleasure, Captain.
And I am Lieutenant Worf of the Enterprise. It's an honor, Captain. I studied your exploits at the Academy. They were most impressive.
The U.S.S. Discovery? A Klingon... on the Enterprise?
An Enterprise from the future, Jim. Wherever we ended up has scrambled the timeline.
That would explain Romulans and the Gorn working together. Follow me, we’ve got work to do!
Well, he sure looks like the real deal. Worf, what do you say? Tell me that’s Jim over there!
I’m afraid not, Doctor. It is another one of the Nexus’ creations.
But I believe we should follow him. Let us see how this plays out.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: These are the Gorn I gave the slip. Cunning devils. Let’s take them by surprise!
What, no makeshift dynamite this time?

missions.locDescription: On the Gorn homeworld, the away team finds clues that point them to where Kirk is being held.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission5

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So... Captain. Any idea why does this Gorn “Father of Nests” want you so badly?
I wasn't sure at first, until they referred to me as his “greatest adversary”...
You mean it's the same one you fought after the Cestus III attack?
It’s the only Gorn I’ve ever met. As Spock would say, it’s…
Yeah, yeah.
Cestus III? The frontier colony?
That’s the one. The Gorn attacked it, but before we could defeat them the Gorn Captain and I were taken by a powerful race called the Metrons.
They stuck the two of us on a desolate world and had us fight it out for their amusement. I won, barely. Spared the Gorn’s life.
And now he thanks you for your mercy by plotting with the Romulans!
Well, we didn’t part on the best of terms…
Captain, it’s possible that all of these enemies may just be creations of this dimension we’re trapped in.... this “Nexus”.
Well, they certainly hit hard enough to be real. And I certainly feel real. Can we really take the chance they’re not?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More Gorn guards. This must be where the Nest Father is waiting.
They will not block our way for long!
Wait. Take it from me, Gorn don’t go down as easy as you think.
Bones? Thoughts?
We could try sneaking around. Or we can try a diplomatic approach, but do you really think these lizards will listen?
As a xeno-anthropologist, I think I might have an idea…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Those are Romulans ahead. They must be part of the delegation.
Let’s end this alliance before it gets started!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Keep pushing! We must be close to the center of the base.
Hold up, I think I hear voices coming from inside there!
You're right. And they sound human! More prisoners, maybe?
The door is locked. We must get inside!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So it is you!
<And you... my oldest, finest adversary.>
Why are you doing this? I let you live!
<Before you, Human-Kirk, I was unbeaten. A champion of my people.>
<Until you bested me. For all my strength and might, I tasted defeat for the first time, and at the hands of a lesser species.>
You think I cheated you. Unfairly robbed you of your prestige
<Cheated? No, Human-Kirk. You won with ingenuity and bravery. The only worthy opponent I had ever faced.>
<Now come. Let’s see us see if you can do so again.>

missions.locDescription: The away team and Kirk come face to face with one of his oldest foes, the Gorn Commander.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Your leader failed to honor the terms of our agreement. We do not tolerate betrayal!
The Artemis is detecting weapons powering up on the Romulan Warbird in orbit!
Kirk to Enterprise. Spock, why don’t we give our new friends on the… Artemis, is it?... a helping hand.
Aye, Captain. Moving the Enterprise to intercept the Romulan vessel.
We’ll stay behind and help get the Gorn to safety.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Romulans are beaming down. We’ll have to deal with them first!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I hear something down that corridor. Sounds like more headed this way!
Here is where we should make our stand! There is enough debris that we could construct a barricade.
Or we can force these bulkhead doors closed to buy some time!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Kill them all! A bar of latinum to the first trooper to bring one of them down.
A single bar? I'm not sure whether to be flattered or offended...
Wait, this one's still breathing!
<Ah, Human-ally-of-Kirk. It looks like my fighting days are over.>
Can you help him, Doctor McCoy?
I’m learning Gorn anatomy on the fly, but I’ll give it a shot…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! The Commander wants none of them left alive!
That device over there looks like another piece of Romulan technology.
They must have beamed it in when the attack began.
It’s transmitting our location to the warbird in orbit. We need to disable it!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Must I do everything myself? If my troops can't kill the lot of you, I’ll gladly finish the job!
Spock to Captain Kirk. Sir, we have neutralized the Romulan warbird. Are you and Dr. McCoy ready to beam back aboard the Enterprise?
And that looks like our cue to beam out as well. What do you say, Bones, are you ready to head for home...
I’m sorry, Jim. My place is with Burnham and Worf. You see… You aren’t even real, my friend.
What do you mean I’m not rea--
One moment... I’m getting an energy reading. And it’s growing.
From the artifact?
No - this is coming from.. Somewhere else. The signature appears to resemble some sort of wormhole.... And it’s forming right on top of us!

missions.locDescription: Enraged, Tomalak and the Romulans attack. Only by working togther can Kirk and the Gorn prevail.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission1

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Keep pushing! We must be close to the center of the base.
Hold up, I think I hear voices coming from inside there!
You're right. And they sound human! More prisoners, maybe?
The door is locked. We must get inside!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So it is you!
<And you... my oldest, finest adversary.>
Why are you doing this? I let you live!
<Before you, Human-Kirk, I was unbeaten. A champion of my people.>
<Until you bested me. For all my strength and might, I tasted defeat for the first time, and at the hands of a lesser species.>
You think I cheated you. Unfairly robbed you of your prestige
<Cheated? No, Human-Kirk. You won with ingenuity and bravery. The only worthy opponent I had ever faced.>
<Now come. Let’s see us see if you can do so again.>

missions.locDescription: The away team and Kirk come face to face with one of his oldest foes, the Gorn Commander.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Your leader failed to honor the terms of our agreement. We do not tolerate betrayal!
The Artemis is detecting weapons powering up on the Romulan Warbird in orbit!
Kirk to Enterprise. Spock, why don’t we give our new friends on the… Artemis, is it?... a helping hand.
Aye, Captain. Moving the Enterprise to intercept the Romulan vessel.
We’ll stay behind and help get the Gorn to safety.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Romulans are beaming down. We’ll have to deal with them first!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I hear something down that corridor. Sounds like more headed this way!
Here is where we should make our stand! There is enough debris that we could construct a barricade.
Or we can force these bulkhead doors closed to buy some time!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Kill them all! A bar of latinum to the first trooper to bring one of them down.
A single bar? I'm not sure whether to be flattered or offended...
Wait, this one's still breathing!
<Ah, Human-ally-of-Kirk. It looks like my fighting days are over.>
Can you help him, Doctor McCoy?
I’m learning Gorn anatomy on the fly, but I’ll give it a shot…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! The Commander wants none of them left alive!
That device over there looks like another piece of Romulan technology.
They must have beamed it in when the attack began.
It’s transmitting our location to the warbird in orbit. We need to disable it!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Must I do everything myself? If my troops can't kill the lot of you, I’ll gladly finish the job!
Spock to Captain Kirk. Sir, we have neutralized the Romulan warbird. Are you and Dr. McCoy ready to beam back aboard the Enterprise?
And that looks like our cue to beam out as well. What do you say, Bones, are you ready to head for home...
I’m sorry, Jim. My place is with Burnham and Worf. You see… You aren’t even real, my friend.
What do you mean I’m not rea--
One moment... I’m getting an energy reading. And it’s growing.
From the artifact?
No - this is coming from.. Somewhere else. The signature appears to resemble some sort of wormhole.... And it’s forming right on top of us!

missions.locDescription: Enraged, Tomalak and the Romulans attack. Only by working togther can Kirk and the Gorn prevail.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ah, Doctor McCoy. A pleasure to hear your voice. And you as well, Michael, after all this time.
Wait...  you two know each other? How?
A story for another time. Unfortunately, Captain Kirk is missing. The shuttle he was aboard has vanished.
Long range scans detect a Federation distress signal on Trigon VII, the planet you are orbiting... It could be from the captain.
Your assistance in locating him would be appreciated. Enterprise out.
Was that really him? Was it Spock?
No… His resonance signature is consistent with the Nexus. The real Spock is still out there, somewhere…
Then he is no more than a phantom. Still, we do not know if the Kirk he described is real or not. We should investigate.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Have you found the human whose signal we intercepted?
No. The commander won’t be pleased. Wait.. Over there! Federation dogs!
The commander will be happier when we bring her prisoners of war! Weapons ready!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: My tricorder shows a storm blowing in. We’d better move quickly.
How do you know Spock, anyway? Were you students together at the Vulcan science academy?
We're siblings, Doctor. And before you ask, I was adopted.
Hmphh. You do seem a little green-blooded…
I’m detecting a Starfleet beacon from within that shuttle...
No sign of Jim. He must still be out there. We should check the shuttlecraft’s logs.
We should proceed with caution and scan the area. There may be more Romulans cloaked nearby.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stop! This is as far as you go.
What have you done with Captain Kirk?
The captain is in very good hands. But it is a pity you’ll never see him again.

missions.locDescription: The U.S.S Artemis recieves a message from Starfleet - Captain Kirk has vanished.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission2

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: You fools run blindly toward your deaths!
Empty words from a coward’s mouth! To battle!
Sub-commander, what is your status? Respond!
Sela! You bring dishonor to the name of Tasha Yar.
I'm working for the good of my people. I haven’t betrayed them, like you have.
You fool! You’re trapped in this “Nexus” just like we are!
“Nexus”? What nonsense is this?
She doesn’t know… What if she’s part of this place?
Enough of this. Where is Captain Kirk?
If you value your lives, you will forget your captain!
Farewell. I can’t imagine we’ll meet again.
A Romulan encampment, hastily abandoned. We should search it for clues to Kirk’s location.
That device over there looks like a comms unit. I’ll try to hack it’s logs…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We’ll need to subdue these Romulans before they warn Sela of our approach!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: You again? I’m surprised you were able to sneak up on our position.
How positively Romulan of you!
You won’t get away this! Hand over Captain Kirk!
Should I be threatened by a doctor?
Your self-righteousness bores me. Let’s get this over with.

missions.locDescription: The hunt for Kirk brings the away team into conflict with Romulan mercenaries.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission3

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: What is that?!
You wouldn’t have met one yet, but Jim Kirk did. They’re called the Gorn.
Drazz'tak norshgrrz!
It seems the universal translator is having difficulty with the Gorn language...
He is challenging us to battle! Prepare yourselves!
I'm picking up a Romulan transmission originating nearby
It must be the unit escorting Captain Kirk
Maybe... let me see if I can intercept the signal.
... proceed to the designated location. We look forward to meeting with your ambassador in person.
Be wary of… pests that may interfere with our meeting. Tomalak out.
That is Tomalak, a Romulan Commander. My Enterprise has had several encounters with him.
He is duplicitous, and will stop at nothing to meet his goal.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I have found a piece of Romulan technology. It seems to be the source of the transmissions.
I might be able to access it and replay more of their communications.
I’m picking up Gorn life-signs over that ridge. They might lead us to Jim.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Commander Tomalak has ordered you eliminated, Federation pests.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Commander Tomalak, the meeting with the Gorn delegates commences as planned.
Are we really forging an alliance with these brutes?
My dear sub-commander, you shouldn’t be unkind to our hosts.
After all, they will be on the front line when we expand into Federation space.
Brilliant, Commander. What of the Federation spies we’ve detected?
Dispose of them quietly. They must not interfere with our meeting.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Just ahead… Keep your voices down. There's something happening.
“Something” is right. I see Romulans AND Gorn.
...we’ve made good on our promise to deliver Kirk. Now... Do we have your support?
<The Nest Father appreciates your gift as he approaches the great shedding.>
It’s using a translator device. I’m surprised the Gorn have a tool meant for diplomacy.
<The One known as Kirk is on his way to the Nest Father's base. But...>
<Before we speak further… I assume the Federation troops stalking behind those rocks aren't your allies…>
My apologies. We will see to this intrusion.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

missions.locDescription: The team uncover evidence of a far reaching plot to create an alliance between the Romulans and the Gorn.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Captain Kirk must be nearby. But among these rocks... it's like finding a needle in the proverbial haystack.
Can you try tracking his communicator? He might have managed to hide it when he was captured.
It's working! He's close!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: What on earth happened to them?
It's Jim! Jim happened to them.
We should scan the area to see which way he went.
One of the Gorn is still alive. Perhaps he will have knowledge of Captain Kirk.
I’m no herpetologist, Mr. Worf, but maybe there’s something I can do for him.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So the Gorn brought you here as well? You’ll hand over your equipment, or we’ll take it from you.
We’re hardly prisoners. We’re here for my friend!
First one to bring down the Klingon gets his bat'leth!
Jim! Is that you, man?
Bones! I’ve never been happier to see you!
But what on earth are you doing here? Who are your friends?
Commander Burnham of the U.S.S. Discovery. It’s a pleasure, Captain.
And I am Lieutenant Worf of the Enterprise. It's an honor, Captain. I studied your exploits at the Academy. They were most impressive.
The U.S.S. Discovery? A Klingon... on the Enterprise?
An Enterprise from the future, Jim. Wherever we ended up has scrambled the timeline.
That would explain Romulans and the Gorn working together. Follow me, we’ve got work to do!
Well, he sure looks like the real deal. Worf, what do you say? Tell me that’s Jim over there!
I’m afraid not, Doctor. It is another one of the Nexus’ creations.
But I believe we should follow him. Let us see how this plays out.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: These are the Gorn I gave the slip. Cunning devils. Let’s take them by surprise!
What, no makeshift dynamite this time?

missions.locDescription: On the Gorn homeworld, the away team finds clues that point them to where Kirk is being held.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission5

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So... Captain. Any idea why does this Gorn “Father of Nests” want you so badly?
I wasn't sure at first, until they referred to me as his “greatest adversary”...
You mean it's the same one you fought after the Cestus III attack?
It’s the only Gorn I’ve ever met. As Spock would say, it’s…
Yeah, yeah.
Cestus III? The frontier colony?
That’s the one. The Gorn attacked it, but before we could defeat them the Gorn Captain and I were taken by a powerful race called the Metrons.
They stuck the two of us on a desolate world and had us fight it out for their amusement. I won, barely. Spared the Gorn’s life.
And now he thanks you for your mercy by plotting with the Romulans!
Well, we didn’t part on the best of terms…
Captain, it’s possible that all of these enemies may just be creations of this dimension we’re trapped in.... this “Nexus”.
Well, they certainly hit hard enough to be real. And I certainly feel real. Can we really take the chance they’re not?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More Gorn guards. This must be where the Nest Father is waiting.
They will not block our way for long!
Wait. Take it from me, Gorn don’t go down as easy as you think.
Bones? Thoughts?
We could try sneaking around. Or we can try a diplomatic approach, but do you really think these lizards will listen?
As a xeno-anthropologist, I think I might have an idea…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Those are Romulans ahead. They must be part of the delegation.
Let’s end this alliance before it gets started!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Keep pushing! We must be close to the center of the base.
Hold up, I think I hear voices coming from inside there!
You're right. And they sound human! More prisoners, maybe?
The door is locked. We must get inside!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan and Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Gorn life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So it is you!
<And you... my oldest, finest adversary.>
Why are you doing this? I let you live!
<Before you, Human-Kirk, I was unbeaten. A champion of my people.>
<Until you bested me. For all my strength and might, I tasted defeat for the first time, and at the hands of a lesser species.>
You think I cheated you. Unfairly robbed you of your prestige
<Cheated? No, Human-Kirk. You won with ingenuity and bravery. The only worthy opponent I had ever faced.>
<Now come. Let’s see us see if you can do so again.>

missions.locDescription: The away team and Kirk come face to face with one of his oldest foes, the Gorn Commander.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode2_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Your leader failed to honor the terms of our agreement. We do not tolerate betrayal!
The Artemis is detecting weapons powering up on the Romulan Warbird in orbit!
Kirk to Enterprise. Spock, why don’t we give our new friends on the… Artemis, is it?... a helping hand.
Aye, Captain. Moving the Enterprise to intercept the Romulan vessel.
We’ll stay behind and help get the Gorn to safety.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Romulans are beaming down. We’ll have to deal with them first!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I hear something down that corridor. Sounds like more headed this way!
Here is where we should make our stand! There is enough debris that we could construct a barricade.
Or we can force these bulkhead doors closed to buy some time!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Kill them all! A bar of latinum to the first trooper to bring one of them down.
A single bar? I'm not sure whether to be flattered or offended...
Wait, this one's still breathing!
<Ah, Human-ally-of-Kirk. It looks like my fighting days are over.>
Can you help him, Doctor McCoy?
I’m learning Gorn anatomy on the fly, but I’ll give it a shot…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! The Commander wants none of them left alive!
That device over there looks like another piece of Romulan technology.
They must have beamed it in when the attack began.
It’s transmitting our location to the warbird in orbit. We need to disable it!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Must I do everything myself? If my troops can't kill the lot of you, I’ll gladly finish the job!
Spock to Captain Kirk. Sir, we have neutralized the Romulan warbird. Are you and Dr. McCoy ready to beam back aboard the Enterprise?
And that looks like our cue to beam out as well. What do you say, Bones, are you ready to head for home...
I’m sorry, Jim. My place is with Burnham and Worf. You see… You aren’t even real, my friend.
What do you mean I’m not rea--
One moment... I’m getting an energy reading. And it’s growing.
From the artifact?
No - this is coming from.. Somewhere else. The signature appears to resemble some sort of wormhole.... And it’s forming right on top of us!

missions.locDescription: Enraged, Tomalak and the Romulans attack. Only by working togther can Kirk and the Gorn prevail.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode3_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hu'tegh! This atmosphere burns hotter than the fire caverns of Boreth!
I’ll take your word for it. The ship’s picking up a long-range mayday transmission… Federation by the sound of it.
Look over there, towards those hills… There’s some sort of device half-buried in the sand. Could it be coming from that?
No, but scans show massive amounts of energy contained inside that thing; enough to knock a starship out of orbit!
Should we investigate?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Starfleet scum! You thought you could kidnap the great Gul Dukat?
We didn’t kidnap anyone. Lower your weapons!
It is pointless to reason with Cardassians, Burnham.
You’ll pay for this treachery with your lives!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hmmm… There are several sets of footprints here, most likely Cardassian. A large group passing right through the dune.
They’re heading straight for the mayday signal.
There’s a smaller set of footprints heading off to the side, around the dune. It might be a shortcut!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us! A crashed Starfleet shuttle!
That’s the source of the mayday.
Hurry, let’s look for survivors!

missions.locDescription: A mysterious signal reaches the U.S.S Artemis from the surface of a desert planet.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode3_Mission2

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I don’t recognize this shuttle type…
It is a runabout from Deep Space Nine, Doctor, after your time.
Nobody’s here, but the debris fields stretches over the dunes.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Federation fools! Cease your pursuit of Gul Dukat! You have no authority here!
Ah! *growls*Now the Cardassian presence here makes sense. They're attempting to rescue their Commander!
Looks like some kind of a starship graveyard!
Judging by the damage, they were all downed by the same weapon that struck the shuttle.
The footprints lead directly through it.
Looks like a dust storm’s closing in. Better hurry, or we’ll be breathing sand!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s some form of encampment by those rocks.
Looks like a makeshift shelter, maybe Dukat’s?
This blasted sand covered his tracks!
Let’s investigate. There may still be something there we can use to find him.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Will your kind never learn?! I will not be caged!
Stand down, Dukat! We have you outnumbered.
You think I face you alone? The gods are on my side.
Odo was a fool to think this is some mere trinket.
This is a BLACK DURANJA: a vessel fashioned to contain the power of the PAH WRAITHS!
AGGHHHHHHHHH!

missions.locDescription: In the ruins of a prison transport, the away team find that Gul Dukat has escaped capitivity.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode3_Mission3

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Just when I was glad to be rid of the Cardassians…
Walk away! This is our territory now. Your kind is not welcome here.
Bah! On whose orders do you claim this planet?
Our own! Any treasure buried in these sands is ours!
Mercenaries! The lowest form of honor-less dogs.
Hah! I'd be insulted if this wasn’t coming from a Klingon lackey of the Federation!
So, this friend of yours - Odo - any idea where he would have gone?
He would have first sought shelter from the storms.
Well, I can't match Vulcans when it comes to logic, but…
…the shuttle crashed in a valley with only two obvious exits. We know Dukat went one way. My best guess is Odo went the other.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! The mercenaries’ camp!
The area must be teeming with them.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stop! It's another one of the alien devices.
This one is more active than the other. Scans reveal heavier shielding, and energy pulsing out across nearby rocks.
We should steer clear of it. Finding Odo is our priority.
Let’s look for a path around it.
I’d say that’s a door built to keep people out. Or to keep something in.
Yes, and its architecture and patterns are similar to those other devices we’ve come across.
It seems to be shut tight. I don’t see a way Odo could have gotten inside.
Odo’s form is somewhat... fluid. He’s able to change it in order to get through tight spaces.
Sounds like Starfleet’s now recruiting all kinds of interesting folks.
Well, if nobody’s got the key, how do we open this thing?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Thank you for leading us inside, Federation fools!
You congratulate yourselves too soon!

missions.locDescription: Prisoner secure, the away team hunt for the shuttle's pilot - Odo.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode3_Mission4

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Resist...
...futile...
Ahead of us – a Borg drone!
A… Borg? Like a cyborg?
No. The Borg are a predatory race of organic life forms assimilated into a collective hivemind. They are the greatest threat the Federation has ever faced!
Exizztenz...
...iz -  iz -  izzz over…
Well, when you put it that way…
Careful! There's some sort of flooding here.
Scans show high amounts of dimethyl cadmium, hexavalent chromium and a mix of other toxic ingredients.
Not a cocktail you want to drink.
Time is short. We can simply wade across.
I can give you a hypospray to prepare you, but don’t blame me for the hangover.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Up ahead! Are those… Starfleet crew?
What are the odds that Starfleet officers are just hanging around an abandoned alien facility?
Look at their eyes! I’ve not known eyes that glow like that.
They’ve spotted us. And they don’t look friendly!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Borg! Hundreds of them!
They seem... dormant?
It could be that they all shut down when the lights went out in here.
Let's investigate.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It’s another one of those devices we saw outside.
Do you hear that humming? I think it’s powering up!
If it is indeed a Borg creation, we must try to shut it down.
Easier said than done. It’s heavily shielded.
Looks like the locals are waking up!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! That door must be important. It's heavily guarded.
We are...the B-B-Borg.
You will be...
....be... assimilated.
RESISTANCE IS…
FUTILE!

missions.locDescription: Odo's trail leads into a ruined Borg outpost, buried deep beneath the shifting sands.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode3_Mission5

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We're lost, aren't we?
No. We're just... navigating cautiously.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Mimetic life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of those strange-eyed doppelgangers! Ready your weapons!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Mimetic life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Worf! Over here!
Odo!
You’re that last face I expected to see. But a welcome one!
The Borg have kept in this shielded room for days.
Do you have any idea what they're up to?
They attempted to assimilate me, fortunately with no success.
Now the Borg seem interested in my ability to shapeshift. I’ve been prodded and poked more times than I care to count.
We can try to overload the shields with short phaser bursts.
That might draw unwelcome attention. I can try to hack it.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Mimetic life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of the doppelgangers!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Primary Objective: Protect pool from intruders.
Secondary protocol: Assimilation.
What “pool” are they talking about?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: That must be the pool the drone mentioned!
It’s Mimetic fluid… It’s able to sample DNA and produce clones of the original life-form.
This could allow the Borg to multiply indefinitely, faster than by assimilating other species!
None of the doppelgangers we’ve encountered seem to be Borg, though. That means they have yet to successfully utilize the pool.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Dr. Crusher to -zZzt- away team. Are you receiving -Zzzt- transmission?
Doctor, is that you? Our communications seem compromised.
Worf? I don't -BzzT- came from but I need your help!
This outpost -Bzzt- Quarantined. There’s -zZzt- without more supplies.
There’s a Theragen -zZzt- medical supply cache. If you can bring it to me -Bzzt- save lives.
Our primary objective should be getting the supplies she mentioned.
Maybe along the way we can figure out what’s interfering with our communications...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Through those trees... is that... it is! Looks like one of our guys!
Gragghhhhh!
Something's terribly wrong with them. Look at the way they move!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Look ahead, more Starfleet officers. Are they unconscious?
We should move on. They may still be dangerous.
Real or not, we ought to treat the poor devils, not leave them to die. I swore the Hippocratic oath!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Lieutenant Commander La Forge?
You know this man?
La Forge is the most talented engineer I have ever served with.
Raggghhhhhh!
Well, for god's sake, man... Tell him to stop attacking us!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: My scans show that device is the source of the comm interference. I don’t recognize the design...
It is Romulan. There are signs of a battle here... we should press on. Romulans do not fight honorably, they may be cloaked nearby.
Hold on... If I can decipher the access logs, I might be able to find out where our Romulan “friends” are hiding.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Romulans?! What are they doing here?

Luckily, I've been able to reverse engineer the toxin based on the Klingon research.
While it previously acted as a stimulant, it will now act as a sedative.
...slowing their growth and rendering the creatures dormant. Great work, Doctor!
The final step would be to release the compound to the air and force the creatures into a dormant state. We wouldn't want to kill an intelligent species, after all!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahog ot ymg'? Ymg''ll ah'mglw'nafh geb!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over here! Here's the first of the air filters.

Once the hosts begin to breathe this in, the gas should put them and the parasites out like a light.
Allowing us to extract them and save whomever they've infected.
Where do we head to next?
We need to proceed to the filtration unit. The longer we wait, the worse this is going to get.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We've done it! The compound should be flooded with gas shortly.

A means to an end. Dogs, if you will. Barking whenever their master commands.
Dogs?! You dare call a Klingon a dog?

Why, do you know the Klingons thought I was a human? The Romulans as well.
And I’m guessing you’re not?
Hardly, Doctor McCoy. Don't you recognize your former patient?
Wait... that voice!
Don't you recognize KHAN NOONIEN SINGH?!

missions.locDescription: Cure in hand, the away team return to the colony and attempt to distribute it.

Don't you recognize KHAN NOONIEN SINGH?!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Dr. Crusher to -zZzt- away team. Are you receiving -Zzzt- transmission?
Doctor, is that you? Our communications seem compromised.
Worf? I don't -BzzT- came from but I need your help!
This outpost -Bzzt- Quarantined. There’s -zZzt- without more supplies.
There’s a Theragen -zZzt- medical supply cache. If you can bring it to me -Bzzt- save lives.
Our primary objective should be getting the supplies she mentioned.
Maybe along the way we can figure out what’s interfering with our communications...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Through those trees... is that... it is! Looks like one of our guys!
Gragghhhhh!
Something's terribly wrong with them. Look at the way they move!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Look ahead, more Starfleet officers. Are they unconscious?
We should move on. They may still be dangerous.
Real or not, we ought to treat the poor devils, not leave them to die. I swore the Hippocratic oath!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Lieutenant Commander La Forge?
You know this man?
La Forge is the most talented engineer I have ever served with.
Raggghhhhhh!
Well, for god's sake, man... Tell him to stop attacking us!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: My scans show that device is the source of the comm interference. I don’t recognize the design...
It is Romulan. There are signs of a battle here... we should press on. Romulans do not fight honorably, they may be cloaked nearby.
Hold on... If I can decipher the access logs, I might be able to find out where our Romulan “friends” are hiding.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Romulans?! What are they doing here?
Graggghhhh!
This illness doesn’t discriminate between species... That doesn’t bode well.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Sub-commander, I am awaiting your report on the infection.
Commander, our forces have become compromised by this... disease. There are only a handful of men remaining.
It is of no consequence. Were you able to secure a sample?
...Yes, commander.
Good. Return once you dispose of any evidence of our involvement.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us! This must be the cache of supplies Dr. Crusher mentioned...

missions.locDescription: A call for help leads to a colony suffering from a mysterious disease.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode4_Mission2

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Away team to Dr. Crusher. The medical supplies are secured.
Excellent. I’ll need you to bring them to me in the local clinic.
This disease is spreading too quickly, and we're being overwhelmed.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hmmm... This might be a problem. I can't see an obvious way forward.
Our phasers should be able to destroy the obstruction.
And let the whole damn base know where we are? Are you mad?
Burnham, do you think you can unlock that door?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Scotty!? Damn it, man... What are you doing skulking around in this closet?
Och, I was overwhelmed when trying to rustle up some supplies for the local doctor.
Luckily, the lock was sturdy but it’s a good thing you found me!
You'd better come with us.
Aye, that I will.  This place has turned into a madhouse.  Besides, never hurts to have a proper engineer on yeh side, eh?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It is good to see you, Doctor.
It’s good to see you too, Worf. I see you’ve brought friends.
Doctor McCoy! This... It’s an honor! I studied your treatise on Gorn retroviruses at the academy.
Well now I feel old. Flattered, but old!
What's the situation?
We're dealing with a pathogen that seems to have a near 100% rate of infection.
100%?!  That's impossible... I assume you tried standard antibiotics? What about retrovirals?
Yes. It doesn't seem to respond to...
This is fascinating, Doctor, but you two might want to hurry this up...
The infected are just outside... We don’t have much time. I don’t think those doors will hold for long.
A Klingon never runs from battle. Open the door! We shall face them in combat.
I have a canister of neurazine gas in my lab. Can any of you create a system to disperse it outside?
I’ve been experimenting with the Theragen compound you brought back.
Scanning the infected, I’m not yet sure how to cure them. The infecting agent... it seems synthetic.
Doctor, any clues as to the source?
I can’t be certain, but there are certain biomarkers in their blood stream in common with Klingon ribosomes.
I’ll continue my research and try to...
...I’m sorry, I’m just feeling a bit faint.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Here they come!

missions.locDescription: Battling against maddened inhabitants, the away team makes its way to Dr Beverly Crusher's clinic.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode4_Mission3

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ugh... I'm having problems focusing on this equipment... I...
... Doctor? Are you all right?
R'ythlettg... Ugh... I have a way of slowing the disease, but I need more Theragen... to be sure.
Um... I think you need to step away from her. Right. Now.
Ragghhhhhh!
Tell me you can cure her, Dr. McCoy.
Possibly. She was a genius and had been working on a cure for a while.
There might be something in her notes we can use but... I'm not sure how far she managed to get.
If we could just find more Theragen, there could be a chance...
Let's have a look around.
If all else fails, we may be able to find more medical supplies in a nearby compound.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Doctor Crusher, any way we can complete synthesizing the cure?
You’ll need more... Theragen... There’s a path through the forest... You should be able to avoid some of the infected.
That’s enough, Beverly. You need your rest.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Romulan life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the place. Do either of you see anything that looks like Theragen?
These crates will take hours to search! The infected could be upon us at any moment.
I may be able to program our tricorders to scan for the Theragen, if we can enter its molecular resonance frequency.
That’s genius! You’d give old Spock a run for his money.
Thank you, Doctor. It... runs in the family.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: They're breaking in!
Urggahhhhh!
Was... Was that a language?
This isn’t the time for a linguistics class. It’s the time to act!
I’ve been through all of the Doctor’s notes. They’re incredible. Her scans of the nucleotides of-
Doctor! Can you save her?
I’ve already administered a potential cure, but Worf... There’s no guarantee she’ll pull through.
Her breathing is easing. Whatever you did, it’s working.
Hmm... She’s a fighter, but so is this damn illness.
Now that's odd. Her research noted that the pathogen seemed to resemble betatephlin.
And that's unusual because...?
Betatephlin is a drug. As far as I remember, it's only produced on a single planet... Lupix IV.

missions.locDescription: The infection has claimed Dr. Crusher as a victim. The away team must neutralize her and restore order.

Who are you? No doubt in league with that... Traitor? We will not be betrayed again! I’m going to call for the guards.
We don’t have much time before they arrive.
Well... Someone say something!
I shouldn't give my research to you, but you are... very convincing.
The “virus” we created is merely a modified form of the drug betatephlin, re-engineered to act as a carrier for a biological lifeform.
What's driving your colleagues “mad” isn't a disease. It's a parasite.
Fortunately, we created a cure - a drug that affects the creatures and renders them dormant.
I'll never forget you. Perhaps... If we'd met in another century... When our kind wasn’t at war.
Burnham to Artemis. We have the cure and we’re ready to beam out!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stop!
Look out!
Stop them before they destroy the equipment!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: They're right behind us!
We need to hold them off. This looks to be where they're manufacturing the drug they've used on the colony.
With luck we can find something here that we can use towards the cure.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stay away from those plants! The scientist has ordered them protected!

missions.locDescription: Clues to the disease point towards a Klingon research facility; this outbreak might not be natural.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I've double checked the information. This is simply astounding.
It appears whoever this traitor was, he gave the Klingons a delivery system for a parasitic entity - one that quickly matures into a fully-grown and intelligent form.
I came to that conclusion. Damndest thing I've ever seen. Makes me all... itchy just thinking about it.
Luckily, I've been able to reverse engineer the toxin based on the Klingon research.
While it previously acted as a stimulant, it will now act as a sedative.
...slowing their growth and rendering the creatures dormant. Great work, Doctor!
The final step would be to release the compound to the air and force the creatures into a dormant state. We wouldn't want to kill an intelligent species, after all!

Don't you recognize KHAN NOONIEN SINGH?!

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I appreciate your response. I had no idea a Federation ship was in the neighborhood.
Have you been trapped here in the Nexus like us?
I’m not sure I follow you…
Burnham, it appears this Janeway and her crew are creations of the Nexus. But they are no doubt our best chance to locate the next reactor.
What’s the situation on the ground?
We have a potential powder keg between us and the Klingon forces on this planet.
Xaxos 7 is a designated neutral territory, claimed by both sides. Both maintain small outposts on the surface but each rarely comes into contact with one another.
The Klingons avoid us, we avoid them, and peace prevails. Until recently, at least. Voyager answered a distress call from the Federation outpost here.
Our probes picked up what appeared to be a Klingon ship approaching the colony . Before we could hail them, it exploded and crashed in neutral territory.
You can understand the sensitive nature of this. We want to know what happened and, if possible, offer assistance.
For all we know this was the prelude to an attack.
Can't you just beam over to the crash site?
As your skip's scanners have probably noticed, any attempt to beam seems distorted by the unique magnetic field of the planet.
Fair enough. If we want to investigate the crash, we'll have to do it on foot.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hang on. I get the feeling we're being watched.
You are. Come to finish your dirty work?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Wait. There's something toxic in the air.
My tricorder's picking up unusual amounts of ammonia and carbon monoxide. Whatever those mushrooms are spewing out is deadly.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead. More scouts. I thought this was meant to be neutral territory.
Not today apparently.
Indeed. It looks like we're not the only group hunting for the ship.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! Is that the ship?
It'd have to be a pretty small ship if it was. I think it's just debris, nothing more.
Definitely Klingon in design. Hmmm... from the looks of it, it appears to be part of a Bird-of-Prey. It must have broken off when the vessel was descending.
Then we're close. And judging from the way the ground is torn up, the ship must have been falling towards the east. C'mon.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Starfleet conspirators! Stop them before they threaten the craft!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stop right there.
Great... there's a welcoming party.
Welcoming? Unlikely, after you shot our ship down!
Us? We're just here to offer assistance. The Federation saw your ship's trajectory, witnessed a flare and assumed there'd been a malfunction.
Malfunction!? We were on a routine patrol when we encountered one of your vessels moving through the upper atmosphere.
Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
Well, it wasn't us.
If not you... who?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So, what happened here? The Federation saw your ship's trajectory, witnessed a flare and assumed there'd been a malfunction.
Malfunction!? Hardly. We were on a routine patrol when we encountered a vessel moving through the upper atmosphere.
Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
I assume you fought back?
Of course, boy. We fought back hard enough to bring them down as well, but not before they knocked us out of the sky.
Until now I assumed it was the Federation breaking the truce. But... if I'm wrong...
Then there's someone else on the planet. Someone hostile to you... and most likely us.

missions.locDescription: Tensions are risng between the Federation and the Klingon Empire in the Neutral Zone.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission2

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Can our ship scan the surface and see anything?
The Artemis is reporting that the magnetic field surrounding Xaxos 7 is still rendering most long-range scans useless.
Still... we might have more luck running a localized scan. Hmmm....
Well don't keep us in suspense. Anything?
Just background noise... chatter from the Federation base... huh. Several mercenary broadcasts coming out of the planet's wastelands.
Wait. That's odd.
You've found something?
Maybe? I'm picking up what sounds like a repeating set of numbers, trillions of digits broadcasting incredibly quickly. This could be them!
Great. Lead on!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Huh... Federation. You're a long way from home.
