Cardassians! Although, from the looks of it, not ones allied with their Empire.
Mercenaries! Looks like Janeway's intel about groups of bandits operating on the planet was accurate.
Okay... I'm completely lost. All I see is trees, trees and more trees.
Well... we're obviously... huh. Okay. Even the path has vanished.
Is the signal still broadcasting?
Yes. Right through that mass of foliage. I'm not sure there's a direct route to it though.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More debris up ahead.
No, it's not the same. It's not Klingon wreckage. It looks... odd. Sharper, somehow. This must be from whatever the Klingons fought.
It's too damaged to make out much, but you're right. It's definitely not Federation.
Cardassian maybe? The mercenaries operating in this region might have a ship.
No. I've seen enough of their vessels to know this is something else. And that worries me.
C'mon. The signal is stronger here, so we're moving in the right direction.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us! Phaser blasts!
And someone shouting in Klingon!
These are Klingons alright. And looks like they're under attack from mercenaries!
Need a hand?
From the Federation? Bah... It shames me, but we will accept your help.
More of that alien debris ahead.
And more of those mercenaries! It looks like they've set up camp nearby and plan to seize whatever crashed near here.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold your ground! Use any cover you can and don't let them draw you out!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: They're charging right at us!
Get ready. Phasers on full!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I could have sworn I heard voices near here.
Fan out... It could be either the Federation or Klingons.
Hold your position... steady... steady.... Now!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the mercenaries' main camp.
If we move quickly, we’ll be able to get the drop on them!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I KNEW I'd seen that alien tech before. It's Borg!
So that thing over there, that half buried sphere...
Is a Borg Probe. And where one goes, more will follow.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: WE ARE THE BORG. YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED. RESISTANCE IS FUTILE.
Just as friendly as the ones we met before, eh?
But they seem more... animated! The other ones were decaying.

missions.locDescription: A Klingon Bird-of-Prey has been shot down by a mysterious attacker.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission3

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: ... can anyone hea.... me? *crackle* Under attack!
We're reading you, Captain.
We need help immediately! A Borg Cube has appeared overhead. We're fighting back but drones are already assimilating hundreds here.
Worse, we've lost communications with Seven of Nine. She has access to all the base's defensive codes!
If they've re-assimilated her, the Borg will be able to use that knowledge to crack us open like an egg!
Focus on saving as many of your troops as you can. We'll find her!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Their ship's the size of an Earth city. I knew they were advanced but... I had no idea they were this powerful.
RESISTANCE IS FUTILE. WE ARE THE BORG. YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
And so loud! C'mon, we need to find Seven of Nine before these things overwhelm us.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This is insane. We need to get out of here!
Stop being a coward. The Federation defenses are down and they're all busy fighting these robots.
We'll never get a better chance to loot their tech than now.
... ... are they trying to steal from the base while the Borg are invading? Really?!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Damnit. This way's blocked.
A security protocol must be in effect. It will have sealed all the entrances to repel any invaders.
Unfortunately, it's keeping us out as well. Solutions, gentlemen?
Over there! More survivors.
Good to see you once more. I was worried we'd lost you when communications went down.
Here and ready to help, ma'am. What do you need?
Let's get these civilians beamed up to that fancy ship of yours.
You and I... we need to rescue Seven of Nine.
You found her then?
Her comm signals just ahead but her vitals are going crazy. I think the Borg have her.
Then we need to get to her quickly. C'mon!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Help... me. Help... THE COLLECTIVE REQUIRES YOU REJOI... they're eating away… at my mind… YOU WILL BE REASSIMILATED INTO SERVE UNIMATRIX ZERO ONE…
They've begun the re-assimilation. If we don't stop it immediately, they'll harvest everything she knows and crack the base open like an egg!
Well, what are we waiting for?

missions.locDescription: Borg drones are attacking the planet and plan to re-assimilate Seven of Nine.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: My thanks for the rescue.
Of course. I only regret that you had to suffer at their hands.
It was... instructive.
While I was linked once again to the collective, I saw the breadth of their plans for this planet.
Despite their overwhelming power, the Cube we're fighting is merely a scout ship.
If we fail in destroying it, we risk it alerting the others.
Yeah, we don’t need any more guests at this party.
They'll use Xaxos 7 as a beachhead and devastate the quadrant.
The Cube is too heavily shielded for us to attack directly. Our best approach would be to disable the Cube from within.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I will never get used to these Borg structures.
We must find our bearings and eliminate these drones!
Take a look at this device here. Stands out, don’t you think?
Good eye, Doctor. This appears to be a data distribution node. There's a flood of information flowing through it.
Anything we can use to our advantage?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: STOP. RESISTANCE IS FUTILE. ASSIMILATION IS CERTAIN.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us are those recharging stations we’ve encountered before but…
...Far more functional. Are they awake?
They're in statis while they connect to the collective.
Ugh... I feel like we’re at the center of a hornet’s nest. One move and the entire thing will swarm.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold on. I recognize this device.
Oh? Well don't keep us in suspense, man.  What is it?
I believe this is a I data distribution node; an access directly into the Cube’s logs.
Interesting. Let’s see… Huh.  That’s odd.
Something wrong?
Not exactly.  The Node has logs on hundreds of planets all assimilated like they're trying to do with this one.  Then… it looks like they encountered something that bit back.
Another race?
If I'm reading this right it means ‘the Dreamless’.
And after that, everything is scrambled.  All log entries and dates are corrupted and out of place. Measurements are wrong.
Almost as if the laws of physics just collapsed all around them.
Great.  Another mysterious thing to worry about!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm picking up a significant number of energy signatures ahead of us.
I'm assuming it’s more Borg?
Almost certainly. Judging by their positions, it appears to be a group gathered in some sort of defensive formation.
Defensive or not - we need to get through.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This looks like another one of those data-majigs.
I could see what we could do with this one…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's our target
Hmm, I can see some of the damage Seven of Nine mentioned.
They’re pretty far along in the repair and restoring their ability to connect to the Collective.
INTRUDER DETECTED IN RELAY STATION 677-BX3. COUNTER MEASURES DEPLOYING.

missions.locDescription: The away team needs tor prevent the Cube from contacting the Collective for more reinforcements.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission5

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm getting a transmission from the Artemis. Reinforcements have arrived!
What?! We just risked life and limb to stop that from happening!
Not theirs, Doctor, ours! The Artemis is reporting waves of Federation and Klingon vessels exiting warp and attacking the cube.
The onslaught is working. The Cube has left low orbit and is starting to retreat back into deep space.
Success?
Indeed! I suggest we start our own retreat!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Klingons are already here?!
More likely recent captives of the Borg. Notice the forcefield keeping them in place.
Less noticing, more captive freeing.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This place is a maze and its shielding is preventing us from beaming to safety.
I don’t suppose they have a schematic of this place? You know, something they hand out to prospective buyers?
I can connect to one of the data distribution nodes and trace the circuitry it's connected to in order to create a rough layout of the Cube.
Let me see... This is so alien it is almost impossible to understand.
Can we get a general idea of where we are?
Scans show we're close to the center of the structure.
We’re getting incoming communication from the Artemis.
They’re saying the Cube is badly damaged. It's rapidly retreating from the attacking fleet.
I suspect the Cube is attempting to return to the Collective physically.
If they manage to do this, the Borg will know the location of the Xaxos 7 and her colonists. We can’t let that happen.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: SIGNAL DETECTED IN SECTION 6-XB6. INVESTIGATE AND ELIMINATE INTRUDERS.
More alarms. I think they’re onto us.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More captives. We must free them if this Cube is to be destroyed!
You think the same tactic will work again? Aren't these fellas constantly upgrading to adapt to threats?
Hopefully not that quickly, especially being cut off from the Collective.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: STAY WHERE YOU ARE. ASSIMILATION COMMENCING.
Well, we gave it one heck of a shot, but I think we may have really angered them this time.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: YOUR EFFORTS ARE FUTILE. ALL WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
This drone must be the Cube's commander.
That isn’t a drone, is… Jean-Luc Picard.
He was captured by the Borg once and assimilated, but we had rescued him! We brought him back!
Snap out of it, man! That's not your captain. Just some nightmare the Nexus has dreamt up.
THERE IS NO DREAMING IN THE COLLECTIVE. WE ARE NOT NIGHTMARES. WE ARE REALITY. SUBMIT.

missions.locDescription: The Borg are retreating back into a Transwarp conduit and attempting to physically contact the Collective.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Well, aren’t you a resourceful pest?
Someone is transmitting on our comms. I can't block it.
Your machines are already part of the Collective. Your bodies and minds will soon follow.
You may already know, but it bears repeating that resistance is futile. You only need to submit and be fulfilled.
Sounds like you don't know much about the Federation if you simply expect us to roll over on your command!
Roll over, play dead. We are Borg. Your actions have only delayed the inevitable. When we return to the Collective you will be... *hiss*
I've managed to mask our signal for now.
I had heard that voice before, or at least one like it.
It’s now obvious why this Cube is still active. The drones will not rest until we remove their Queen...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Still you scurry around in the shadows, struggling against the inevitable.
I was hoping we'd be able to avoid detection for longer.
She's everywhere, every part of the circuitry around us. We need to keep moving.
To what end, “Worf”?
We like this one - this ”Worf”. Strong and able-bodied. You will make a fine addition to the Collective.
And your mind will reveal much about your race when you're assimilated.
For all her pride in being efficient and cold, she’s pretty fond of theatrics!
She has her drones surrounding us!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's so many of them....
I believe the human phrase “the more the merrier”.
Yeah, that’s not what it’s about.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s another one of those data nodes. Might be useful, if we’ve got time to scan it, that is.
Step aside, Doctor.  This shouldn't take too long.
Anything useful?
Again, the code’s corrupted like the one we found earlier.
Some sort of virus perhaps? They are similar to synthetics in many ways…
That’s… actually a fairly accurate description of what I'm looking at.
Before the Cube was damaged, everything was normal. Afterwards, it’s jumbled. At first I thought it was just numerology. Dates and distances.
But now? It’s more than that.  The code has bits of random text everywhere. Alien languages unlike anything I've ever seen.
If I didn't know better I'd say it was like the data had been overwritten by thousands of different voices.
Given how these things harvest people, is that so surprising? Maybe their old personalities got free?
Possibly, Doctor.  It’s just… odd. Very odd. And in the Nexus that makes me uncomfortable!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Follow me! See if you can get past them.
There's a gap over there.
When you say 'gap'...
I mean significantly less than the horde behind us. That'll do!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Major security here, and a forcefield up. No doubt this facility is of high importance.
There’s a major energy reading beyond this barrier. It would be safe to assume it’s the Cube’s warp core.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s an opening in the wall here.
Possibly a maintenance corridor that’s gone abandoned.
Abandoned? The Borg don't strike me as the type who waste anything.
Come, Doctor. Where is your sense of adventure?
Back on the Artemis. However, I do have a hearty dollop of “I told you so” ready to be served at a moment’s notice.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Here it is. Let me see if I can remodulate the input.
Dimming lights are a good indication that you did it!
Let's get to the warp core before the Queen sends more drones our way.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the Cube's warp core!
It's magnificent... and terrifying.
Is it me or is that one of those Nexus Reactors that we’ve been finding?
You’ve come upon more of these, “Doctor McCoy”? I’d be most interested to relieve you of their possession. This one has proven to be an energy source like no other.
The shield just went up behind us!
You don't think we’d want you leaving, do you?
You've shown yourselves to be rare flesh forms. Creative, intelligent and determined.
And your “Artemis” is running a technology that will be a fine addition to the Collective.
The hell it will!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We've neutralized your drones. Stand down!
Drones? WE ARE BORG.
ALL IS BORG. YOU HAVE DEFEATED NOTHING MORE THAN STRANDS WITHIN THE GLORY THAT IS THE COLLECTIVE!
Okay... I think we made her angry.
YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED. YOU WILL JOIN THE COLLECTIVE AND ALL WILL BE AT PEACE AND WELL!

missions.locDescription: Something or someone is still controling the Borg and needs to be stopped.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I appreciate your response. I had no idea a Federation ship was in the neighborhood.
Have you been trapped here in the Nexus like us?
I’m not sure I follow you…
Burnham, it appears this Janeway and her crew are creations of the Nexus. But they are no doubt our best chance to locate the next reactor.
What’s the situation on the ground?
We have a potential powder keg between us and the Klingon forces on this planet.
Xaxos 7 is a designated neutral territory, claimed by both sides. Both maintain small outposts on the surface but each rarely comes into contact with one another.
The Klingons avoid us, we avoid them, and peace prevails. Until recently, at least. Voyager answered a distress call from the Federation outpost here.
Our probes picked up what appeared to be a Klingon ship approaching the colony . Before we could hail them, it exploded and crashed in neutral territory.
You can understand the sensitive nature of this. We want to know what happened and, if possible, offer assistance.
For all we know this was the prelude to an attack.
Can't you just beam over to the crash site?
As your skip's scanners have probably noticed, any attempt to beam seems distorted by the unique magnetic field of the planet.
Fair enough. If we want to investigate the crash, we'll have to do it on foot.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hang on. I get the feeling we're being watched.
You are. Come to finish your dirty work?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Wait. There's something toxic in the air.
My tricorder's picking up unusual amounts of ammonia and carbon monoxide. Whatever those mushrooms are spewing out is deadly.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead. More scouts. I thought this was meant to be neutral territory.
Not today apparently.
Indeed. It looks like we're not the only group hunting for the ship.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! Is that the ship?
It'd have to be a pretty small ship if it was. I think it's just debris, nothing more.
Definitely Klingon in design. Hmmm... from the looks of it, it appears to be part of a Bird-of-Prey. It must have broken off when the vessel was descending.
Then we're close. And judging from the way the ground is torn up, the ship must have been falling towards the east. C'mon.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Starfleet conspirators! Stop them before they threaten the craft!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stop right there.
Great... there's a welcoming party.
Welcoming? Unlikely, after you shot our ship down!
Us? We're just here to offer assistance. The Federation saw your ship's trajectory, witnessed a flare and assumed there'd been a malfunction.
Malfunction!? We were on a routine patrol when we encountered one of your vessels moving through the upper atmosphere.
Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
Well, it wasn't us.
If not you... who?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So, what happened here? The Federation saw your ship's trajectory, witnessed a flare and assumed there'd been a malfunction.
Malfunction!? Hardly. We were on a routine patrol when we encountered a vessel moving through the upper atmosphere.
Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
I assume you fought back?
Of course, boy. We fought back hard enough to bring them down as well, but not before they knocked us out of the sky.
Until now I assumed it was the Federation breaking the truce. But... if I'm wrong...
Then there's someone else on the planet. Someone hostile to you... and most likely us.

missions.locDescription: Tensions are risng between the Federation and the Klingon Empire in the Neutral Zone.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission2

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Can our ship scan the surface and see anything?
The Artemis is reporting that the magnetic field surrounding Xaxos 7 is still rendering most long-range scans useless.
Still... we might have more luck running a localized scan. Hmmm....
Well don't keep us in suspense. Anything?
Just background noise... chatter from the Federation base... huh. Several mercenary broadcasts coming out of the planet's wastelands.
Wait. That's odd.
You've found something?
Maybe? I'm picking up what sounds like a repeating set of numbers, trillions of digits broadcasting incredibly quickly. This could be them!
Great. Lead on!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Huh... Federation. You're a long way from home.
Cardassians! Although, from the looks of it, not ones allied with their Empire.
Mercenaries! Looks like Janeway's intel about groups of bandits operating on the planet was accurate.
Okay... I'm completely lost. All I see is trees, trees and more trees.
Well... we're obviously... huh. Okay. Even the path has vanished.
Is the signal still broadcasting?
Yes. Right through that mass of foliage. I'm not sure there's a direct route to it though.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More debris up ahead.
No, it's not the same. It's not Klingon wreckage. It looks... odd. Sharper, somehow. This must be from whatever the Klingons fought.
It's too damaged to make out much, but you're right. It's definitely not Federation.
Cardassian maybe? The mercenaries operating in this region might have a ship.
No. I've seen enough of their vessels to know this is something else. And that worries me.
C'mon. The signal is stronger here, so we're moving in the right direction.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us! Phaser blasts!
And someone shouting in Klingon!
These are Klingons alright. And looks like they're under attack from mercenaries!
Need a hand?
From the Federation? Bah... It shames me, but we will accept your help.
More of that alien debris ahead.
And more of those mercenaries! It looks like they've set up camp nearby and plan to seize whatever crashed near here.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold your ground! Use any cover you can and don't let them draw you out!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: They're charging right at us!
Get ready. Phasers on full!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I could have sworn I heard voices near here.
Fan out... It could be either the Federation or Klingons.
Hold your position... steady... steady.... Now!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the mercenaries' main camp.
If we move quickly, we’ll be able to get the drop on them!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I KNEW I'd seen that alien tech before. It's Borg!
So that thing over there, that half buried sphere...
Is a Borg Probe. And where one goes, more will follow.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: WE ARE THE BORG. YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED. RESISTANCE IS FUTILE.
Just as friendly as the ones we met before, eh?
But they seem more... animated! The other ones were decaying.

missions.locDescription: A Klingon Bird-of-Prey has been shot down by a mysterious attacker.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission3

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: ... can anyone hea.... me? *crackle* Under attack!
We're reading you, Captain.
We need help immediately! A Borg Cube has appeared overhead. We're fighting back but drones are already assimilating hundreds here.
Worse, we've lost communications with Seven of Nine. She has access to all the base's defensive codes!
If they've re-assimilated her, the Borg will be able to use that knowledge to crack us open like an egg!
Focus on saving as many of your troops as you can. We'll find her!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Their ship's the size of an Earth city. I knew they were advanced but... I had no idea they were this powerful.
RESISTANCE IS FUTILE. WE ARE THE BORG. YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
And so loud! C'mon, we need to find Seven of Nine before these things overwhelm us.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This is insane. We need to get out of here!
Stop being a coward. The Federation defenses are down and they're all busy fighting these robots.
We'll never get a better chance to loot their tech than now.
... ... are they trying to steal from the base while the Borg are invading? Really?!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Damnit. This way's blocked.
A security protocol must be in effect. It will have sealed all the entrances to repel any invaders.
Unfortunately, it's keeping us out as well. Solutions, gentlemen?
Over there! More survivors.
Good to see you once more. I was worried we'd lost you when communications went down.
Here and ready to help, ma'am. What do you need?
Let's get these civilians beamed up to that fancy ship of yours.
You and I... we need to rescue Seven of Nine.
You found her then?
Her comm signals just ahead but her vitals are going crazy. I think the Borg have her.
Then we need to get to her quickly. C'mon!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Help... me. Help... THE COLLECTIVE REQUIRES YOU REJOI... they're eating away… at my mind… YOU WILL BE REASSIMILATED INTO SERVE UNIMATRIX ZERO ONE…
They've begun the re-assimilation. If we don't stop it immediately, they'll harvest everything she knows and crack the base open like an egg!
Well, what are we waiting for?

missions.locDescription: Borg drones are attacking the planet and plan to re-assimilate Seven of Nine.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: My thanks for the rescue.
Of course. I only regret that you had to suffer at their hands.
It was... instructive.
While I was linked once again to the collective, I saw the breadth of their plans for this planet.
Despite their overwhelming power, the Cube we're fighting is merely a scout ship.
If we fail in destroying it, we risk it alerting the others.
Yeah, we don’t need any more guests at this party.
They'll use Xaxos 7 as a beachhead and devastate the quadrant.
The Cube is too heavily shielded for us to attack directly. Our best approach would be to disable the Cube from within.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I will never get used to these Borg structures.
We must find our bearings and eliminate these drones!
Take a look at this device here. Stands out, don’t you think?
Good eye, Doctor. This appears to be a data distribution node. There's a flood of information flowing through it.
Anything we can use to our advantage?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: STOP. RESISTANCE IS FUTILE. ASSIMILATION IS CERTAIN.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us are those recharging stations we’ve encountered before but…
...Far more functional. Are they awake?
They're in statis while they connect to the collective.
Ugh... I feel like we’re at the center of a hornet’s nest. One move and the entire thing will swarm.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold on. I recognize this device.
Oh? Well don't keep us in suspense, man.  What is it?
I believe this is a I data distribution node; an access directly into the Cube’s logs.
Interesting. Let’s see… Huh.  That’s odd.
Something wrong?
Not exactly.  The Node has logs on hundreds of planets all assimilated like they're trying to do with this one.  Then… it looks like they encountered something that bit back.
Another race?
If I'm reading this right it means ‘the Dreamless’.
And after that, everything is scrambled.  All log entries and dates are corrupted and out of place. Measurements are wrong.
Almost as if the laws of physics just collapsed all around them.
Great.  Another mysterious thing to worry about!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm picking up a significant number of energy signatures ahead of us.
I'm assuming it’s more Borg?
Almost certainly. Judging by their positions, it appears to be a group gathered in some sort of defensive formation.
Defensive or not - we need to get through.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This looks like another one of those data-majigs.
I could see what we could do with this one…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's our target
Hmm, I can see some of the damage Seven of Nine mentioned.
They’re pretty far along in the repair and restoring their ability to connect to the Collective.
INTRUDER DETECTED IN RELAY STATION 677-BX3. COUNTER MEASURES DEPLOYING.

missions.locDescription: The away team needs tor prevent the Cube from contacting the Collective for more reinforcements.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission5

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm getting a transmission from the Artemis. Reinforcements have arrived!
What?! We just risked life and limb to stop that from happening!
Not theirs, Doctor, ours! The Artemis is reporting waves of Federation and Klingon vessels exiting warp and attacking the cube.
The onslaught is working. The Cube has left low orbit and is starting to retreat back into deep space.
Success?
Indeed! I suggest we start our own retreat!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Klingons are already here?!
More likely recent captives of the Borg. Notice the forcefield keeping them in place.
Less noticing, more captive freeing.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This place is a maze and its shielding is preventing us from beaming to safety.
I don’t suppose they have a schematic of this place? You know, something they hand out to prospective buyers?
I can connect to one of the data distribution nodes and trace the circuitry it's connected to in order to create a rough layout of the Cube.
Let me see... This is so alien it is almost impossible to understand.
Can we get a general idea of where we are?
Scans show we're close to the center of the structure.
We’re getting incoming communication from the Artemis.
They’re saying the Cube is badly damaged. It's rapidly retreating from the attacking fleet.
I suspect the Cube is attempting to return to the Collective physically.
If they manage to do this, the Borg will know the location of the Xaxos 7 and her colonists. We can’t let that happen.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: SIGNAL DETECTED IN SECTION 6-XB6. INVESTIGATE AND ELIMINATE INTRUDERS.
More alarms. I think they’re onto us.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More captives. We must free them if this Cube is to be destroyed!
You think the same tactic will work again? Aren't these fellas constantly upgrading to adapt to threats?
Hopefully not that quickly, especially being cut off from the Collective.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: STAY WHERE YOU ARE. ASSIMILATION COMMENCING.
Well, we gave it one heck of a shot, but I think we may have really angered them this time.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: YOUR EFFORTS ARE FUTILE. ALL WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
This drone must be the Cube's commander.
That isn’t a drone, is… Jean-Luc Picard.
He was captured by the Borg once and assimilated, but we had rescued him! We brought him back!
Snap out of it, man! That's not your captain. Just some nightmare the Nexus has dreamt up.
THERE IS NO DREAMING IN THE COLLECTIVE. WE ARE NOT NIGHTMARES. WE ARE REALITY. SUBMIT.

missions.locDescription: The Borg are retreating back into a Transwarp conduit and attempting to physically contact the Collective.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Well, aren’t you a resourceful pest?
Someone is transmitting on our comms. I can't block it.
Your machines are already part of the Collective. Your bodies and minds will soon follow.
You may already know, but it bears repeating that resistance is futile. You only need to submit and be fulfilled.
Sounds like you don't know much about the Federation if you simply expect us to roll over on your command!
Roll over, play dead. We are Borg. Your actions have only delayed the inevitable. When we return to the Collective you will be... *hiss*
I've managed to mask our signal for now.
I had heard that voice before, or at least one like it.
It’s now obvious why this Cube is still active. The drones will not rest until we remove their Queen...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Still you scurry around in the shadows, struggling against the inevitable.
I was hoping we'd be able to avoid detection for longer.
She's everywhere, every part of the circuitry around us. We need to keep moving.
To what end, “Worf”?
We like this one - this ”Worf”. Strong and able-bodied. You will make a fine addition to the Collective.
And your mind will reveal much about your race when you're assimilated.
For all her pride in being efficient and cold, she’s pretty fond of theatrics!
She has her drones surrounding us!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's so many of them....
I believe the human phrase “the more the merrier”.
Yeah, that’s not what it’s about.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s another one of those data nodes. Might be useful, if we’ve got time to scan it, that is.
Step aside, Doctor.  This shouldn't take too long.
Anything useful?
Again, the code’s corrupted like the one we found earlier.
Some sort of virus perhaps? They are similar to synthetics in many ways…
That’s… actually a fairly accurate description of what I'm looking at.
Before the Cube was damaged, everything was normal. Afterwards, it’s jumbled. At first I thought it was just numerology. Dates and distances.
But now? It’s more than that.  The code has bits of random text everywhere. Alien languages unlike anything I've ever seen.
If I didn't know better I'd say it was like the data had been overwritten by thousands of different voices.
Given how these things harvest people, is that so surprising? Maybe their old personalities got free?
Possibly, Doctor.  It’s just… odd. Very odd. And in the Nexus that makes me uncomfortable!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Follow me! See if you can get past them.
There's a gap over there.
When you say 'gap'...
I mean significantly less than the horde behind us. That'll do!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Major security here, and a forcefield up. No doubt this facility is of high importance.
There’s a major energy reading beyond this barrier. It would be safe to assume it’s the Cube’s warp core.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s an opening in the wall here.
Possibly a maintenance corridor that’s gone abandoned.
Abandoned? The Borg don't strike me as the type who waste anything.
Come, Doctor. Where is your sense of adventure?
Back on the Artemis. However, I do have a hearty dollop of “I told you so” ready to be served at a moment’s notice.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Here it is. Let me see if I can remodulate the input.
Dimming lights are a good indication that you did it!
Let's get to the warp core before the Queen sends more drones our way.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the Cube's warp core!
It's magnificent... and terrifying.
Is it me or is that one of those Nexus Reactors that we’ve been finding?
You’ve come upon more of these, “Doctor McCoy”? I’d be most interested to relieve you of their possession. This one has proven to be an energy source like no other.
The shield just went up behind us!
You don't think we’d want you leaving, do you?
You've shown yourselves to be rare flesh forms. Creative, intelligent and determined.
And your “Artemis” is running a technology that will be a fine addition to the Collective.
The hell it will!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We've neutralized your drones. Stand down!
Drones? WE ARE BORG.
ALL IS BORG. YOU HAVE DEFEATED NOTHING MORE THAN STRANDS WITHIN THE GLORY THAT IS THE COLLECTIVE!
Okay... I think we made her angry.
YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED. YOU WILL JOIN THE COLLECTIVE AND ALL WILL BE AT PEACE AND WELL!

missions.locDescription: Something or someone is still controling the Borg and needs to be stopped.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I appreciate your response. I had no idea a Federation ship was in the neighborhood.
Have you been trapped here in the Nexus like us?
I’m not sure I follow you…
Burnham, it appears this Janeway and her crew are creations of the Nexus. But they are no doubt our best chance to locate the next reactor.
What’s the situation on the ground?
We have a potential powder keg between us and the Klingon forces on this planet.
Xaxos 7 is a designated neutral territory, claimed by both sides. Both maintain small outposts on the surface but each rarely comes into contact with one another.
The Klingons avoid us, we avoid them, and peace prevails. Until recently, at least. Voyager answered a distress call from the Federation outpost here.
Our probes picked up what appeared to be a Klingon ship approaching the colony . Before we could hail them, it exploded and crashed in neutral territory.
You can understand the sensitive nature of this. We want to know what happened and, if possible, offer assistance.
For all we know this was the prelude to an attack.
Can't you just beam over to the crash site?
As your skip's scanners have probably noticed, any attempt to beam seems distorted by the unique magnetic field of the planet.
Fair enough. If we want to investigate the crash, we'll have to do it on foot.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hang on. I get the feeling we're being watched.
You are. Come to finish your dirty work?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Wait. There's something toxic in the air.
My tricorder's picking up unusual amounts of ammonia and carbon monoxide. Whatever those mushrooms are spewing out is deadly.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead. More scouts. I thought this was meant to be neutral territory.
Not today apparently.
Indeed. It looks like we're not the only group hunting for the ship.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Over there! Is that the ship?
It'd have to be a pretty small ship if it was. I think it's just debris, nothing more.
Definitely Klingon in design. Hmmm... from the looks of it, it appears to be part of a Bird-of-Prey. It must have broken off when the vessel was descending.
Then we're close. And judging from the way the ground is torn up, the ship must have been falling towards the east. C'mon.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Starfleet conspirators! Stop them before they threaten the craft!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Stop right there.
Great... there's a welcoming party.
Welcoming? Unlikely, after you shot our ship down!
Us? We're just here to offer assistance. The Federation saw your ship's trajectory, witnessed a flare and assumed there'd been a malfunction.
Malfunction!? We were on a routine patrol when we encountered one of your vessels moving through the upper atmosphere.
Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
Well, it wasn't us.
If not you... who?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: So, what happened here? The Federation saw your ship's trajectory, witnessed a flare and assumed there'd been a malfunction.
Malfunction!? Hardly. We were on a routine patrol when we encountered a vessel moving through the upper atmosphere.
Before we could hail them, they opened fire, crippling our engines!
I assume you fought back?
Of course, boy. We fought back hard enough to bring them down as well, but not before they knocked us out of the sky.
Until now I assumed it was the Federation breaking the truce. But... if I'm wrong...
Then there's someone else on the planet. Someone hostile to you... and most likely us.

missions.locDescription: Tensions are risng between the Federation and the Klingon Empire in the Neutral Zone.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission2

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Can our ship scan the surface and see anything?
The Artemis is reporting that the magnetic field surrounding Xaxos 7 is still rendering most long-range scans useless.
Still... we might have more luck running a localized scan. Hmmm....
Well don't keep us in suspense. Anything?
Just background noise... chatter from the Federation base... huh. Several mercenary broadcasts coming out of the planet's wastelands.
Wait. That's odd.
You've found something?
Maybe? I'm picking up what sounds like a repeating set of numbers, trillions of digits broadcasting incredibly quickly. This could be them!
Great. Lead on!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Huh... Federation. You're a long way from home.
Cardassians! Although, from the looks of it, not ones allied with their Empire.
Mercenaries! Looks like Janeway's intel about groups of bandits operating on the planet was accurate.
Okay... I'm completely lost. All I see is trees, trees and more trees.
Well... we're obviously... huh. Okay. Even the path has vanished.
Is the signal still broadcasting?
Yes. Right through that mass of foliage. I'm not sure there's a direct route to it though.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More debris up ahead.
No, it's not the same. It's not Klingon wreckage. It looks... odd. Sharper, somehow. This must be from whatever the Klingons fought.
It's too damaged to make out much, but you're right. It's definitely not Federation.
Cardassian maybe? The mercenaries operating in this region might have a ship.
No. I've seen enough of their vessels to know this is something else. And that worries me.
C'mon. The signal is stronger here, so we're moving in the right direction.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us! Phaser blasts!
And someone shouting in Klingon!
These are Klingons alright. And looks like they're under attack from mercenaries!
Need a hand?
From the Federation? Bah... It shames me, but we will accept your help.
More of that alien debris ahead.
And more of those mercenaries! It looks like they've set up camp nearby and plan to seize whatever crashed near here.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold your ground! Use any cover you can and don't let them draw you out!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: They're charging right at us!
Get ready. Phasers on full!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I could have sworn I heard voices near here.
Fan out... It could be either the Federation or Klingons.
Hold your position... steady... steady.... Now!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the mercenaries' main camp.
If we move quickly, we’ll be able to get the drop on them!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I KNEW I'd seen that alien tech before. It's Borg!
So that thing over there, that half buried sphere...
Is a Borg Probe. And where one goes, more will follow.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: WE ARE THE BORG. YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED. RESISTANCE IS FUTILE.
Just as friendly as the ones we met before, eh?
But they seem more... animated! The other ones were decaying.

missions.locDescription: A Klingon Bird-of-Prey has been shot down by a mysterious attacker.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission3

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: ... can anyone hea.... me? *crackle* Under attack!
We're reading you, Captain.
We need help immediately! A Borg Cube has appeared overhead. We're fighting back but drones are already assimilating hundreds here.
Worse, we've lost communications with Seven of Nine. She has access to all the base's defensive codes!
If they've re-assimilated her, the Borg will be able to use that knowledge to crack us open like an egg!
Focus on saving as many of your troops as you can. We'll find her!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Their ship's the size of an Earth city. I knew they were advanced but... I had no idea they were this powerful.
RESISTANCE IS FUTILE. WE ARE THE BORG. YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
And so loud! C'mon, we need to find Seven of Nine before these things overwhelm us.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This is insane. We need to get out of here!
Stop being a coward. The Federation defenses are down and they're all busy fighting these robots.
We'll never get a better chance to loot their tech than now.
... ... are they trying to steal from the base while the Borg are invading? Really?!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Damnit. This way's blocked.
A security protocol must be in effect. It will have sealed all the entrances to repel any invaders.
Unfortunately, it's keeping us out as well. Solutions, gentlemen?
Over there! More survivors.
Good to see you once more. I was worried we'd lost you when communications went down.
Here and ready to help, ma'am. What do you need?
Let's get these civilians beamed up to that fancy ship of yours.
You and I... we need to rescue Seven of Nine.
You found her then?
Her comm signals just ahead but her vitals are going crazy. I think the Borg have her.
Then we need to get to her quickly. C'mon!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Help... me. Help... THE COLLECTIVE REQUIRES YOU REJOI... they're eating away… at my mind… YOU WILL BE REASSIMILATED INTO SERVE UNIMATRIX ZERO ONE…
They've begun the re-assimilation. If we don't stop it immediately, they'll harvest everything she knows and crack the base open like an egg!
Well, what are we waiting for?

missions.locDescription: Borg drones are attacking the planet and plan to re-assimilate Seven of Nine.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: My thanks for the rescue.
Of course. I only regret that you had to suffer at their hands.
It was... instructive.
While I was linked once again to the collective, I saw the breadth of their plans for this planet.
Despite their overwhelming power, the Cube we're fighting is merely a scout ship.
If we fail in destroying it, we risk it alerting the others.
Yeah, we don’t need any more guests at this party.
They'll use Xaxos 7 as a beachhead and devastate the quadrant.
The Cube is too heavily shielded for us to attack directly. Our best approach would be to disable the Cube from within.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I will never get used to these Borg structures.
We must find our bearings and eliminate these drones!
Take a look at this device here. Stands out, don’t you think?
Good eye, Doctor. This appears to be a data distribution node. There's a flood of information flowing through it.
Anything we can use to our advantage?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: STOP. RESISTANCE IS FUTILE. ASSIMILATION IS CERTAIN.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us are those recharging stations we’ve encountered before but…
...Far more functional. Are they awake?
They're in statis while they connect to the collective.
Ugh... I feel like we’re at the center of a hornet’s nest. One move and the entire thing will swarm.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold on. I recognize this device.
Oh? Well don't keep us in suspense, man.  What is it?
I believe this is a I data distribution node; an access directly into the Cube’s logs.
Interesting. Let’s see… Huh.  That’s odd.
Something wrong?
Not exactly.  The Node has logs on hundreds of planets all assimilated like they're trying to do with this one.  Then… it looks like they encountered something that bit back.
Another race?
If I'm reading this right it means ‘the Dreamless’.
And after that, everything is scrambled.  All log entries and dates are corrupted and out of place. Measurements are wrong.
Almost as if the laws of physics just collapsed all around them.
Great.  Another mysterious thing to worry about!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm picking up a significant number of energy signatures ahead of us.
I'm assuming it’s more Borg?
Almost certainly. Judging by their positions, it appears to be a group gathered in some sort of defensive formation.
Defensive or not - we need to get through.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This looks like another one of those data-majigs.
I could see what we could do with this one…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's our target
Hmm, I can see some of the damage Seven of Nine mentioned.
They’re pretty far along in the repair and restoring their ability to connect to the Collective.
INTRUDER DETECTED IN RELAY STATION 677-BX3. COUNTER MEASURES DEPLOYING.

missions.locDescription: The away team needs tor prevent the Cube from contacting the Collective for more reinforcements.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission5

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm getting a transmission from the Artemis. Reinforcements have arrived!
What?! We just risked life and limb to stop that from happening!
Not theirs, Doctor, ours! The Artemis is reporting waves of Federation and Klingon vessels exiting warp and attacking the cube.
The onslaught is working. The Cube has left low orbit and is starting to retreat back into deep space.
Success?
Indeed! I suggest we start our own retreat!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Klingons are already here?!
More likely recent captives of the Borg. Notice the forcefield keeping them in place.
Less noticing, more captive freeing.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This place is a maze and its shielding is preventing us from beaming to safety.
I don’t suppose they have a schematic of this place? You know, something they hand out to prospective buyers?
I can connect to one of the data distribution nodes and trace the circuitry it's connected to in order to create a rough layout of the Cube.
Let me see... This is so alien it is almost impossible to understand.
Can we get a general idea of where we are?
Scans show we're close to the center of the structure.
We’re getting incoming communication from the Artemis.
They’re saying the Cube is badly damaged. It's rapidly retreating from the attacking fleet.
I suspect the Cube is attempting to return to the Collective physically.
If they manage to do this, the Borg will know the location of the Xaxos 7 and her colonists. We can’t let that happen.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: SIGNAL DETECTED IN SECTION 6-XB6. INVESTIGATE AND ELIMINATE INTRUDERS.
More alarms. I think they’re onto us.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More captives. We must free them if this Cube is to be destroyed!
You think the same tactic will work again? Aren't these fellas constantly upgrading to adapt to threats?
Hopefully not that quickly, especially being cut off from the Collective.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: STAY WHERE YOU ARE. ASSIMILATION COMMENCING.
Well, we gave it one heck of a shot, but I think we may have really angered them this time.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: YOUR EFFORTS ARE FUTILE. ALL WILL BE ASSIMILATED.
This drone must be the Cube's commander.
That isn’t a drone, is… Jean-Luc Picard.
He was captured by the Borg once and assimilated, but we had rescued him! We brought him back!
Snap out of it, man! That's not your captain. Just some nightmare the Nexus has dreamt up.
THERE IS NO DREAMING IN THE COLLECTIVE. WE ARE NOT NIGHTMARES. WE ARE REALITY. SUBMIT.

missions.locDescription: The Borg are retreating back into a Transwarp conduit and attempting to physically contact the Collective.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode5_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Well, aren’t you a resourceful pest?
Someone is transmitting on our comms. I can't block it.
Your machines are already part of the Collective. Your bodies and minds will soon follow.
You may already know, but it bears repeating that resistance is futile. You only need to submit and be fulfilled.
Sounds like you don't know much about the Federation if you simply expect us to roll over on your command!
Roll over, play dead. We are Borg. Your actions have only delayed the inevitable. When we return to the Collective you will be... *hiss*
I've managed to mask our signal for now.
I had heard that voice before, or at least one like it.
It’s now obvious why this Cube is still active. The drones will not rest until we remove their Queen...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Still you scurry around in the shadows, struggling against the inevitable.
I was hoping we'd be able to avoid detection for longer.
She's everywhere, every part of the circuitry around us. We need to keep moving.
To what end, “Worf”?
We like this one - this ”Worf”. Strong and able-bodied. You will make a fine addition to the Collective.
And your mind will reveal much about your race when you're assimilated.
For all her pride in being efficient and cold, she’s pretty fond of theatrics!
She has her drones surrounding us!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's so many of them....
I believe the human phrase “the more the merrier”.
Yeah, that’s not what it’s about.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s another one of those data nodes. Might be useful, if we’ve got time to scan it, that is.
Step aside, Doctor.  This shouldn't take too long.
Anything useful?
Again, the code’s corrupted like the one we found earlier.
Some sort of virus perhaps? They are similar to synthetics in many ways…
That’s… actually a fairly accurate description of what I'm looking at.
Before the Cube was damaged, everything was normal. Afterwards, it’s jumbled. At first I thought it was just numerology. Dates and distances.
But now? It’s more than that.  The code has bits of random text everywhere. Alien languages unlike anything I've ever seen.
If I didn't know better I'd say it was like the data had been overwritten by thousands of different voices.
Given how these things harvest people, is that so surprising? Maybe their old personalities got free?
Possibly, Doctor.  It’s just… odd. Very odd. And in the Nexus that makes me uncomfortable!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Follow me! See if you can get past them.
There's a gap over there.
When you say 'gap'...
I mean significantly less than the horde behind us. That'll do!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Major security here, and a forcefield up. No doubt this facility is of high importance.
There’s a major energy reading beyond this barrier. It would be safe to assume it’s the Cube’s warp core.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There’s an opening in the wall here.
Possibly a maintenance corridor that’s gone abandoned.
Abandoned? The Borg don't strike me as the type who waste anything.
Come, Doctor. Where is your sense of adventure?
Back on the Artemis. However, I do have a hearty dollop of “I told you so” ready to be served at a moment’s notice.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Here it is. Let me see if I can remodulate the input.
Dimming lights are a good indication that you did it!
Let's get to the warp core before the Queen sends more drones our way.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the Cube's warp core!
It's magnificent... and terrifying.
Is it me or is that one of those Nexus Reactors that we’ve been finding?
You’ve come upon more of these, “Doctor McCoy”? I’d be most interested to relieve you of their possession. This one has proven to be an energy source like no other.
The shield just went up behind us!
You don't think we’d want you leaving, do you?
You've shown yourselves to be rare flesh forms. Creative, intelligent and determined.
And your “Artemis” is running a technology that will be a fine addition to the Collective.
The hell it will!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Borg life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We've neutralized your drones. Stand down!
Drones? WE ARE BORG.
ALL IS BORG. YOU HAVE DEFEATED NOTHING MORE THAN STRANDS WITHIN THE GLORY THAT IS THE COLLECTIVE!
Okay... I think we made her angry.
YOU WILL BE ASSIMILATED. YOU WILL JOIN THE COLLECTIVE AND ALL WILL BE AT PEACE AND WELL!

missions.locDescription: Something or someone is still controling the Borg and needs to be stopped.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Burnham to Artemis. We've successfully beamed aboard the Pioneer.
Odd. The air smells stale... burnt? Phaser fire perhaps, but I see no obvious signs of a struggle.
Maybe the ship was ambushed and boarded? It might explain where the crew is.
Seems unlikely that a ship of this size could have been caught unaware, but we can't rule anything out.
Wait! I swear I heard something clatter over there...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us! Pioneer officers!
Greetings. We're from the U.S.S. Artemis. Do you, ah, require assistance?
*alien babbling*
That doesn't sound like Federation Standard…
*Urgent alien babble*

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's shielding stopping us going any further.
It looks like the ship is still partially powered.
Powered enough to put something in our path!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Shouts alien babble*
Stay close! There's more of them ahead!
And they look even less friendly than the last lot.
Those people on the floor ahead. Doctor, are they...?
Afraid so. Phaser burns on all of them.
They might have tried to fight back against the infected crew.
This is reminiscent of our time with Dr. Crusher... Come, let’s look for survivors.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More infected. A lot more than we’ve seen elsewhere!
Is it me or do they seem like they're clustered in this area?
Perhaps there’s something here they're drawn to?
I'm bringing up the schematics now. There’s the Sickbay… there may be survivors inside!
We won't know for sure unless we find a way to get past the Pioneer’s crew!
Over there, on the wall. Is that... writing?
Good eye, Doctor. I nearly missed it in the darkness.
“My eyes are not my own…”. I can't make out that particular word.
“In this valley of dying stars. Oh hollow. Oh emp-“. It trails off into unintelligible drivel…
A warning, perhaps?
I'm not sure they even knew what was happening to them. This illness seems to eat away at whomever is infected.
Have you noticed a common thread in all our encounters in the Nexus?
I was just thinking that, Michael.
We keep meeting individuals – even machines – overcome by an outside influence.
Yes. Infected, diseased, malfunctioning, assimilated. A coincidence?
Or perhaps a pattern in all this Nexus chaos…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It appears to be a Starfleet officer. Possibly the former Captain of this ship.
Is he conscious, Doctor? Is he able to speak?
Hold your horses. His life signs are stable, which is a good start.
I’m administering a stimulant!
Who? Wh-where am I?
Woah there. Take it easy, man! You're with friends – we’re of the U.S.S. Artemis. Can you tell me your name?
I... I'm Benjamin Sisko. Acting Captain of the U.S.S. Pioneer.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Someone is lying on the bed there!
He must be the one drawing the infected!
What should we do about them?.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

missions.locDescription: The U.S.S. Artemis finds a lone Starfleet vessel, the U.S.S. Pioneer, adrift and unresponsive.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission2

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: How’s our patient, Doctor?
As far as I can tell, Captain Sisko’s fine. Scans show no signs of physical or mental trauma.
Listen, Captain, we're here to help. Can you tell us what happened to you?
I... I'm not sure, Doctor. Everything feels blurry. Soft somehow.
I remember a gathering somewhere in space. Maybe some kind of reception? I was speaking to a Klingon, and then there was a commotion.
Doctor, but we have company!
We’re cornered inside the Sickbay. More of them will be coming.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Maddening alien noise*
That sound… that’s what people on the ship sounded like as they were being infected!
It was terrible. I heard them crying out, then their voices turned low and guttural.
Here they come!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I... I remember running down this corridor before.
Do you recall what you were doing?
I was... I was looking down at myself. I... I know that doesn't make any sense.
It was as if I was outside my body, watching myself run. It was chaos, crew everywhere. People struggling and shouting.
I was myself, and then… it was as if I was sharing my body with something else.
I'm sorry you had to go through something so terrifying, Captain.
Thank you, Doctor. Please, let’s keep going.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Does this door here lead to the bridge?
To the crew's quarters. Perhaps more of my people have taken shelter in there!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The turbolift should be straight ahead.
Along with what looks like half of your crew! They’re clustered around it.
We must get past them if we want to retake the bridge. Follow me!
I commend your enthusiasm, Captain!
They're retreating, but it looks like the controls have been damaged.
With the shields still up, the Artemis won't be able to beam us directly to the bridge.
Well, we're going to need a new plan. Suggestions?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: No! No! Stay back! Stay… aghhhhhh!
Over there! That’s my first officer!
*alien scream*
My god. That poor devil’s already been corrupted. This virus is unlike anything I've ever seen before!
We can try and treat her later, Doctor. For now, we need to stay alive!
On my left! Drive them away from the controls!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The infected are everywhere! Look out!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We should be safe to search through the logs now.
Captain's Log. Stardat-... *crackle*. En route to the *crackle* system with the delegates.
I'm confident my gift of Klingon bloodw- *crackle* will go down well with Ambassador Martok.
There are not entries for 27 hours following that. And then this…
*crackle* -omething has gone wrong. Cardassians are gone. We're retreati- *crackle* -endezvous with Martok's Bird of Prey in the Kurtz system. I hope w-*crackle*
They're with us. It's inside the ship. Inside us. I think I might be infected. I see colors out of the corner of my eye.
Strange colors. *crackle* Look alien in the mirror. I don't recognize my own fa- *crackle*
And that’s all I could find. What happened to you out there, Captain?
I wish I could remember!

missions.locName: THE LOG OF THE U.S.S. PIONEER
missions.locDescription: The U.S.S. Pioneer's crew have succumbed to a form of madness that renders them confused and highly aggressive.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission3

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Well, we're here. Now what?
Whatever we do, we must proceed cautiously. I'm picking up damage throughout the ship.
Serious damage... It looked like firefights broke out throughout the decks.
And here I assumed it was just part of the decor.
Hold up. I'm receiving a message on comms.
But he’s rather well versed in it. Hold up. I'm receiving a message on comms.
-is commander Martok. Can anyone hear me?
This is Michael Burnham of the U.S.S. Artemis. We are standing by to aid you. Where are you?
Starfleet? On my ship? Wanting to help me? Bah, the ancestors of my house will be cursing me from their graves!
I'm holed up on the bridge. Come and find me before I regret accepting your hel- *crackle*
He cut off. Let’s head to the bridge!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *alien ramblings*
Klingons over there, on the starboard side!
They sound just like the crew of the Pioneer. Whatever they're saying, it's not Klingon.
I think Doctor McCoy was right earlier: there’s no pattern in their utterings that would suggest a cohesive language.
It's like they're as alien to each other as they are to us, struggling to communicate but not sure how.
Let’s stop them killing each other, and then we can discuss the finer points of their dialect!
We're officially lost.
A Klingon is never lost in a Bird of Prey, Doctor.
By all means, take the lead.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It looks like we're not the first to make a stand here. This part of the ship is so damaged, it's a wonder there's anything left!
Ahead of us!
Concentrate your fire! They're shrugging off all but the heaviest of shots.
They've lost all sense of self-preservation! They're just charging straight towards us!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold. Scans are detecting a breach in the corridor ahead.
Someone must have detonated something powerful enough to punch a hole right through the hull of the ship!
Well, this is a fine mess. I don't suppose anyone’s got an EV suit handy?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *crackle* Can anyone hear me? You still with me, Federation whelp?
I'm reading you. Martok. What's your status?
I’m on the bridge. I'm safe for now, but those treacherous dogs have found me.
It’s only a matter of time before they break in here!
We're en route! Are you still able to fight?
Bah... I'm a Klingon, boy. We're born abl- *crackle*
I've lost communications. We need to hurry!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the ship's Sickbay.
More bodies. How horrific.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: That's the Bridge.
Push through!
Can you hear me, Federation? They've breached the doors. Today IS a good day to die! *crackle*
