Captain? Captain?! We need to get in there immediately!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hah! I THOUGHT one of you sounded like a Klingon. Come in and join the battle!
Forward! Jagh yIbuStaH!
I assume that means something… inspirational?

missions.locDescription: Long-ranged scans have revealed a badly damaged Warbird tumbling through space: the I.K.S. Ning'Tao.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The atmosphere seems breathable, but I'm not sure it will last.
I'm reading structural damage across the entire ship.
Similar to the damage inflicted by the crews on the other vessels?
Oddly, no. This vessel has suffered damage on what appears to be a molecular level. It’s almost as if the entire ship is drifting apart!
That may account for the spikes of radiation I’m reading across the ship; my guess is the erosion is causing the warp core to fail.
We must get to the engine room and stabilize it somehow.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Those Cardassian crew members are clearly possessed.
*alien whispering*
If Martok was right, this must be the source of the infection.
There are too many of them!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The shields are holding most of them back.
We need to subdue them before the barrier collapses.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Cardassian language*
And now the ship's yelling at us. Charming. Any idea what it’s saying?
Give the universal translator a moment to adjust.
Warp core critical failure imminent. All crew with security clearance proceed immediately to the officer shuttles for evacuation.
Sorry I asked.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hmmm. Fewer than I expected.
Were you hoping for more?!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's more of them coming from every direction. If we don't do something, we'll be overrun!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the engine room.
Or what's left of it! We need to find a way to shut down the power before it destroys the ship!
*Alien tongue*!
Critical failure imminent. Prepare for incineration.
High Command thanks you for your futile but heroic deaths. Long live the Empir- *crackle*
... ... is that thing playing music?!
I believe that is the Cardassian anthem.
Catchy tune. We should hurry, if only to shut this thing up.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The Bridge should be right ahead of us.
Looks empty except for... is that Dukat?!
It’s Gul Dukat to you! Who are you and how dare you set foot on my ship!
That’s Dukat, all right. A different Nexus version of him, but with the same delightful attitude.

missions.locDescription: Above the planet floats the Cardassian ship Martok warned you about. The Kornaire.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission5

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Cardassians! It must be the remnants of their scouting team!
Stay back. We can't let them infect us.
Woah. That was... unusual.
That was odd. Is everyone all right?
That looks like a temporary camp just over there. Probably erected by the Cardassian landing.
We should reach it and investigate.
Although… this is odd. I'm picking up a strong signal from the east, past those dunes.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This was the Cardassian camp, alright. Or what's left of it.
I'm not picking up any life signs. Whatever happened here was days ago.
Let’s spread out.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human and Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Alien tongue*
Klingons? Here?
Maybe members of the Klingon delegation? Some of them could have escaped the disaster in shuttles...
…fled to the only nearby planet…
Out of the frying pan and into the fire!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *alien language*
Oh, you have to be joking. Who else is on this planet?!
I suggest we don't stay long enough to find out, Doctor!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Have you ever seen anything like this before?
Never. This is eons beyond any recorded technology.
It looks a lot like the Reactors we've been finding.
We may be looking at the machine behind the Nexus. This could be the construct powering each of the realities we had been to.
The message from earlier said the construct is under attack… so as the reality around this “construct” collapses, we're able to see the gears turning…
Exactly!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm picking up something moving towards us.
From which direction, Mr. Worf?
Impossible to say. I'm reading 2... 3... multiple signatures, all converging on our location!
*alien howl*
More and more of the Nexus machinery.
It’s more significant in size than I first thought.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Wait. The energy signatures are spiking.
More of those creatures everywhere!

missions.locDescription: Beaming down to the surface of the planet to find the source of this madness.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The signal we tracked earlier is stronger here. I think it’s communicating directly with us!
Adapting to sub language x-345b. Time period Beta Epsilon 56. Region. Outer Spiral of Galaxy 5b67y. Colloquially known as “the Milky Way”.
Query. Data shows possession of five Cores. Possession indicates potential Engineer capabilities.
The Reactors? Yes! We've found five of them, like you say. Who are we speaking to?
Caretaker 689b-epsilon. Charged with preservation and operation of Reality Engine and associ-*crackle* -pheres.
Where are we?
You ar- *crackle* -ently in the Nexus, in Sphere Construct 789.341.b12.
What do you mean by “Sphere”?
Spher- *crackle* -irtual realities constructed around the consciousness to ensure condition of bliss.
I've lost contact. The signal seems to be deteriorating further.
This is fascinating! The Nexus was constructed with the intent to create these “blissful” dream worlds we had heard about.
So, where did it go wrong? Since we've set foot in the Nexus, it’s all been doom and gloom.
This whole “machine” appears to be breaking down. The realities we’ve visited, the “madness” in the crews we've come across – it all must be part of it.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Energy spikes in front of us.
More of those things are rising out of the sand!

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's rubble everywhere. I can't tell if this is an actual path anymore.
*crackle* -pologies for error in communication. Sphere cohesion at 36% and falling.
Where are we? What is this place?
You are in - as species in your sector classify it - the Nexus.
Can you be more specific?
Of c-... c-... cours- *crackle* This dimension is a repository designed to eliminat- *crackle* -e trauma that connects all life.
Trauma? I don't understand.
The Nexus eliminates pain, strife and death. Each consciousness that enters it is hosted within a dedicated Sphere, providing it eternal bliss.
It’s describing heaven. An artificially-created heaven...

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of them coming!

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I had no concept of the scale or age of this place. That do-hickey mentioned trillions of souls resting inside the Nexus.
And if it's beginning to collapse, every one of them is at risk!
I suggest we start with a full analysis of this technology. Hopefully, it will provide more information on the workings of the Nexus.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of those things. An entire horde of them just standing there like watchdogs.
It's impossible to advance without them noticing us.
Damage to this and nearby Spheres have impacted my abil- *crackle* -unction properly. Code decaying and affecting operation parameters.
What’s the source of this damage?
A flaw within the Nexus caused the fatal collapse of a Sphere approximately 12,356 of your earth cycles ago.
That flaw has now spread, corrupt- *crackle* -estroying 19% of all known spheres.
Wait, didn't it say earlier each “consciousness” that enters the Nexus is hosted in its own dedicated Sphere?
What happened to all those poor souls?
As of this moment, approximately 38,007,684,112 consciousnesses had been extinguished du- *crackle* -flaw.
That is horrendous. What's this flaw?
It’s no good. I've lost communication again.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I've found some containers. They appear Cardassian in design.
Supplies left behind...

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of those things.
They're gunning for us.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We're being overwhelmed.
Things are swarming like bees to honey.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Warning! Spher- *crackle* -tegrity terminally compromised. Flaw approach- *crackle*
Well, that doesn't sound good!
Sphere cohesion at .03% Flee enginee- *crackle* -se the reacto- *crackle* -epair the Engi… EEEEEEEEEEEEEE *crackle*
The signal just died. I fear it’s been destroyed.
That’s not all. This light around us – the same when we were with Kirk and the Gorn! Something’s appearing!
Hello.
Identify yourself!
My name is... it’s been long forgotten. When one spends enough time in this place, memories tend to... decay. And I've been in here for a very, VERY long time.
This machine referred to you as a “flaw”.
Did it? A dreary term from an even drearier machine. I am one of the Dreamless, the closest analogue in your language.
Now, I must demand the Reactor you're holding. I'd prefer you surrender it, but I won't hesitate to take it by force.

missions.locName: NOT WITH A BANG BUT A WHIMPER
missions.locDescription: To boldly go where no one has gone before.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Burnham to Artemis. We've successfully beamed aboard the Pioneer.
Odd. The air smells stale... burnt? Phaser fire perhaps, but I see no obvious signs of a struggle.
Maybe the ship was ambushed and boarded? It might explain where the crew is.
Seems unlikely that a ship of this size could have been caught unaware, but we can't rule anything out.
Wait! I swear I heard something clatter over there...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us! Pioneer officers!
Greetings. We're from the U.S.S. Artemis. Do you, ah, require assistance?
*alien babbling*
That doesn't sound like Federation Standard…
*Urgent alien babble*

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's shielding stopping us going any further.
It looks like the ship is still partially powered.
Powered enough to put something in our path!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Shouts alien babble*
Stay close! There's more of them ahead!
And they look even less friendly than the last lot.
Those people on the floor ahead. Doctor, are they...?
Afraid so. Phaser burns on all of them.
They might have tried to fight back against the infected crew.
This is reminiscent of our time with Dr. Crusher... Come, let’s look for survivors.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More infected. A lot more than we’ve seen elsewhere!
Is it me or do they seem like they're clustered in this area?
Perhaps there’s something here they're drawn to?
I'm bringing up the schematics now. There’s the Sickbay… there may be survivors inside!
We won't know for sure unless we find a way to get past the Pioneer’s crew!
Over there, on the wall. Is that... writing?
Good eye, Doctor. I nearly missed it in the darkness.
“My eyes are not my own…”. I can't make out that particular word.
“In this valley of dying stars. Oh hollow. Oh emp-“. It trails off into unintelligible drivel…
A warning, perhaps?
I'm not sure they even knew what was happening to them. This illness seems to eat away at whomever is infected.
Have you noticed a common thread in all our encounters in the Nexus?
I was just thinking that, Michael.
We keep meeting individuals – even machines – overcome by an outside influence.
Yes. Infected, diseased, malfunctioning, assimilated. A coincidence?
Or perhaps a pattern in all this Nexus chaos…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It appears to be a Starfleet officer. Possibly the former Captain of this ship.
Is he conscious, Doctor? Is he able to speak?
Hold your horses. His life signs are stable, which is a good start.
I’m administering a stimulant!
Who? Wh-where am I?
Woah there. Take it easy, man! You're with friends – we’re of the U.S.S. Artemis. Can you tell me your name?
I... I'm Benjamin Sisko. Acting Captain of the U.S.S. Pioneer.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Someone is lying on the bed there!
He must be the one drawing the infected!
What should we do about them?.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

missions.locDescription: The U.S.S. Artemis finds a lone Starfleet vessel, the U.S.S. Pioneer, adrift and unresponsive.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission2

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: How’s our patient, Doctor?
As far as I can tell, Captain Sisko’s fine. Scans show no signs of physical or mental trauma.
Listen, Captain, we're here to help. Can you tell us what happened to you?
I... I'm not sure, Doctor. Everything feels blurry. Soft somehow.
I remember a gathering somewhere in space. Maybe some kind of reception? I was speaking to a Klingon, and then there was a commotion.
Doctor, but we have company!
We’re cornered inside the Sickbay. More of them will be coming.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Maddening alien noise*
That sound… that’s what people on the ship sounded like as they were being infected!
It was terrible. I heard them crying out, then their voices turned low and guttural.
Here they come!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I... I remember running down this corridor before.
Do you recall what you were doing?
I was... I was looking down at myself. I... I know that doesn't make any sense.
It was as if I was outside my body, watching myself run. It was chaos, crew everywhere. People struggling and shouting.
I was myself, and then… it was as if I was sharing my body with something else.
I'm sorry you had to go through something so terrifying, Captain.
Thank you, Doctor. Please, let’s keep going.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Does this door here lead to the bridge?
To the crew's quarters. Perhaps more of my people have taken shelter in there!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The turbolift should be straight ahead.
Along with what looks like half of your crew! They’re clustered around it.
We must get past them if we want to retake the bridge. Follow me!
I commend your enthusiasm, Captain!
They're retreating, but it looks like the controls have been damaged.
With the shields still up, the Artemis won't be able to beam us directly to the bridge.
Well, we're going to need a new plan. Suggestions?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: No! No! Stay back! Stay… aghhhhhh!
Over there! That’s my first officer!
*alien scream*
My god. That poor devil’s already been corrupted. This virus is unlike anything I've ever seen before!
We can try and treat her later, Doctor. For now, we need to stay alive!
On my left! Drive them away from the controls!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The infected are everywhere! Look out!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We should be safe to search through the logs now.
Captain's Log. Stardat-... *crackle*. En route to the *crackle* system with the delegates.
I'm confident my gift of Klingon bloodw- *crackle* will go down well with Ambassador Martok.
There are not entries for 27 hours following that. And then this…
*crackle* -omething has gone wrong. Cardassians are gone. We're retreati- *crackle* -endezvous with Martok's Bird of Prey in the Kurtz system. I hope w-*crackle*
They're with us. It's inside the ship. Inside us. I think I might be infected. I see colors out of the corner of my eye.
Strange colors. *crackle* Look alien in the mirror. I don't recognize my own fa- *crackle*
And that’s all I could find. What happened to you out there, Captain?
I wish I could remember!

missions.locName: THE LOG OF THE U.S.S. PIONEER
missions.locDescription: The U.S.S. Pioneer's crew have succumbed to a form of madness that renders them confused and highly aggressive.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission3

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Well, we're here. Now what?
Whatever we do, we must proceed cautiously. I'm picking up damage throughout the ship.
Serious damage... It looked like firefights broke out throughout the decks.
And here I assumed it was just part of the decor.
Hold up. I'm receiving a message on comms.
But he’s rather well versed in it. Hold up. I'm receiving a message on comms.
-is commander Martok. Can anyone hear me?
This is Michael Burnham of the U.S.S. Artemis. We are standing by to aid you. Where are you?
Starfleet? On my ship? Wanting to help me? Bah, the ancestors of my house will be cursing me from their graves!
I'm holed up on the bridge. Come and find me before I regret accepting your hel- *crackle*
He cut off. Let’s head to the bridge!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *alien ramblings*
Klingons over there, on the starboard side!
They sound just like the crew of the Pioneer. Whatever they're saying, it's not Klingon.
I think Doctor McCoy was right earlier: there’s no pattern in their utterings that would suggest a cohesive language.
It's like they're as alien to each other as they are to us, struggling to communicate but not sure how.
Let’s stop them killing each other, and then we can discuss the finer points of their dialect!
We're officially lost.
A Klingon is never lost in a Bird of Prey, Doctor.
By all means, take the lead.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It looks like we're not the first to make a stand here. This part of the ship is so damaged, it's a wonder there's anything left!
Ahead of us!
Concentrate your fire! They're shrugging off all but the heaviest of shots.
They've lost all sense of self-preservation! They're just charging straight towards us!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold. Scans are detecting a breach in the corridor ahead.
Someone must have detonated something powerful enough to punch a hole right through the hull of the ship!
Well, this is a fine mess. I don't suppose anyone’s got an EV suit handy?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *crackle* Can anyone hear me? You still with me, Federation whelp?
I'm reading you. Martok. What's your status?
I’m on the bridge. I'm safe for now, but those treacherous dogs have found me.
It’s only a matter of time before they break in here!
We're en route! Are you still able to fight?
Bah... I'm a Klingon, boy. We're born abl- *crackle*
I've lost communications. We need to hurry!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the ship's Sickbay.
More bodies. How horrific.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: That's the Bridge.
Push through!
Can you hear me, Federation? They've breached the doors. Today IS a good day to die! *crackle*
Captain? Captain?! We need to get in there immediately!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hah! I THOUGHT one of you sounded like a Klingon. Come in and join the battle!
Forward! Jagh yIbuStaH!
I assume that means something… inspirational?

missions.locDescription: Long-ranged scans have revealed a badly damaged Warbird tumbling through space: the I.K.S. Ning'Tao.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The atmosphere seems breathable, but I'm not sure it will last.
I'm reading structural damage across the entire ship.
Similar to the damage inflicted by the crews on the other vessels?
Oddly, no. This vessel has suffered damage on what appears to be a molecular level. It’s almost as if the entire ship is drifting apart!
That may account for the spikes of radiation I’m reading across the ship; my guess is the erosion is causing the warp core to fail.
We must get to the engine room and stabilize it somehow.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Those Cardassian crew members are clearly possessed.
*alien whispering*
If Martok was right, this must be the source of the infection.
There are too many of them!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The shields are holding most of them back.
We need to subdue them before the barrier collapses.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Cardassian language*
And now the ship's yelling at us. Charming. Any idea what it’s saying?
Give the universal translator a moment to adjust.
Warp core critical failure imminent. All crew with security clearance proceed immediately to the officer shuttles for evacuation.
Sorry I asked.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hmmm. Fewer than I expected.
Were you hoping for more?!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's more of them coming from every direction. If we don't do something, we'll be overrun!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the engine room.
Or what's left of it! We need to find a way to shut down the power before it destroys the ship!
*Alien tongue*!
Critical failure imminent. Prepare for incineration.
High Command thanks you for your futile but heroic deaths. Long live the Empir- *crackle*
... ... is that thing playing music?!
I believe that is the Cardassian anthem.
Catchy tune. We should hurry, if only to shut this thing up.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The Bridge should be right ahead of us.
Looks empty except for... is that Dukat?!
It’s Gul Dukat to you! Who are you and how dare you set foot on my ship!
That’s Dukat, all right. A different Nexus version of him, but with the same delightful attitude.

missions.locDescription: Above the planet floats the Cardassian ship Martok warned you about. The Kornaire.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission5

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Cardassians! It must be the remnants of their scouting team!
Stay back. We can't let them infect us.
Woah. That was... unusual.
That was odd. Is everyone all right?
That looks like a temporary camp just over there. Probably erected by the Cardassian landing.
We should reach it and investigate.
Although… this is odd. I'm picking up a strong signal from the east, past those dunes.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This was the Cardassian camp, alright. Or what's left of it.
I'm not picking up any life signs. Whatever happened here was days ago.
Let’s spread out.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human and Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Alien tongue*
Klingons? Here?
Maybe members of the Klingon delegation? Some of them could have escaped the disaster in shuttles...
…fled to the only nearby planet…
Out of the frying pan and into the fire!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *alien language*
Oh, you have to be joking. Who else is on this planet?!
I suggest we don't stay long enough to find out, Doctor!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Have you ever seen anything like this before?
Never. This is eons beyond any recorded technology.
It looks a lot like the Reactors we've been finding.
We may be looking at the machine behind the Nexus. This could be the construct powering each of the realities we had been to.
The message from earlier said the construct is under attack… so as the reality around this “construct” collapses, we're able to see the gears turning…
Exactly!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm picking up something moving towards us.
From which direction, Mr. Worf?
Impossible to say. I'm reading 2... 3... multiple signatures, all converging on our location!
*alien howl*
More and more of the Nexus machinery.
It’s more significant in size than I first thought.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Wait. The energy signatures are spiking.
More of those creatures everywhere!

missions.locDescription: Beaming down to the surface of the planet to find the source of this madness.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The signal we tracked earlier is stronger here. I think it’s communicating directly with us!
Adapting to sub language x-345b. Time period Beta Epsilon 56. Region. Outer Spiral of Galaxy 5b67y. Colloquially known as “the Milky Way”.
Query. Data shows possession of five Cores. Possession indicates potential Engineer capabilities.
The Reactors? Yes! We've found five of them, like you say. Who are we speaking to?
Caretaker 689b-epsilon. Charged with preservation and operation of Reality Engine and associ-*crackle* -pheres.
Where are we?
You ar- *crackle* -ently in the Nexus, in Sphere Construct 789.341.b12.
What do you mean by “Sphere”?
Spher- *crackle* -irtual realities constructed around the consciousness to ensure condition of bliss.
I've lost contact. The signal seems to be deteriorating further.
This is fascinating! The Nexus was constructed with the intent to create these “blissful” dream worlds we had heard about.
So, where did it go wrong? Since we've set foot in the Nexus, it’s all been doom and gloom.
This whole “machine” appears to be breaking down. The realities we’ve visited, the “madness” in the crews we've come across – it all must be part of it.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Energy spikes in front of us.
More of those things are rising out of the sand!

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's rubble everywhere. I can't tell if this is an actual path anymore.
*crackle* -pologies for error in communication. Sphere cohesion at 36% and falling.
Where are we? What is this place?
You are in - as species in your sector classify it - the Nexus.
Can you be more specific?
Of c-... c-... cours- *crackle* This dimension is a repository designed to eliminat- *crackle* -e trauma that connects all life.
Trauma? I don't understand.
The Nexus eliminates pain, strife and death. Each consciousness that enters it is hosted within a dedicated Sphere, providing it eternal bliss.
It’s describing heaven. An artificially-created heaven...

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of them coming!

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I had no concept of the scale or age of this place. That do-hickey mentioned trillions of souls resting inside the Nexus.
And if it's beginning to collapse, every one of them is at risk!
I suggest we start with a full analysis of this technology. Hopefully, it will provide more information on the workings of the Nexus.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of those things. An entire horde of them just standing there like watchdogs.
It's impossible to advance without them noticing us.
Damage to this and nearby Spheres have impacted my abil- *crackle* -unction properly. Code decaying and affecting operation parameters.
What’s the source of this damage?
A flaw within the Nexus caused the fatal collapse of a Sphere approximately 12,356 of your earth cycles ago.
That flaw has now spread, corrupt- *crackle* -estroying 19% of all known spheres.
Wait, didn't it say earlier each “consciousness” that enters the Nexus is hosted in its own dedicated Sphere?
What happened to all those poor souls?
As of this moment, approximately 38,007,684,112 consciousnesses had been extinguished du- *crackle* -flaw.
That is horrendous. What's this flaw?
It’s no good. I've lost communication again.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I've found some containers. They appear Cardassian in design.
Supplies left behind...

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of those things.
They're gunning for us.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We're being overwhelmed.
Things are swarming like bees to honey.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Warning! Spher- *crackle* -tegrity terminally compromised. Flaw approach- *crackle*
Well, that doesn't sound good!
Sphere cohesion at .03% Flee enginee- *crackle* -se the reacto- *crackle* -epair the Engi… EEEEEEEEEEEEEE *crackle*
The signal just died. I fear it’s been destroyed.
That’s not all. This light around us – the same when we were with Kirk and the Gorn! Something’s appearing!
Hello.
Identify yourself!
My name is... it’s been long forgotten. When one spends enough time in this place, memories tend to... decay. And I've been in here for a very, VERY long time.
This machine referred to you as a “flaw”.
Did it? A dreary term from an even drearier machine. I am one of the Dreamless, the closest analogue in your language.
Now, I must demand the Reactor you're holding. I'd prefer you surrender it, but I won't hesitate to take it by force.

missions.locName: NOT WITH A BANG BUT A WHIMPER
missions.locDescription: To boldly go where no one has gone before.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission1

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Burnham to Artemis. We've successfully beamed aboard the Pioneer.
Odd. The air smells stale... burnt? Phaser fire perhaps, but I see no obvious signs of a struggle.
Maybe the ship was ambushed and boarded? It might explain where the crew is.
Seems unlikely that a ship of this size could have been caught unaware, but we can't rule anything out.
Wait! I swear I heard something clatter over there...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Ahead of us! Pioneer officers!
Greetings. We're from the U.S.S. Artemis. Do you, ah, require assistance?
*alien babbling*
That doesn't sound like Federation Standard…
*Urgent alien babble*

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's shielding stopping us going any further.
It looks like the ship is still partially powered.
Powered enough to put something in our path!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Shouts alien babble*
Stay close! There's more of them ahead!
And they look even less friendly than the last lot.
Those people on the floor ahead. Doctor, are they...?
Afraid so. Phaser burns on all of them.
They might have tried to fight back against the infected crew.
This is reminiscent of our time with Dr. Crusher... Come, let’s look for survivors.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More infected. A lot more than we’ve seen elsewhere!
Is it me or do they seem like they're clustered in this area?
Perhaps there’s something here they're drawn to?
I'm bringing up the schematics now. There’s the Sickbay… there may be survivors inside!
We won't know for sure unless we find a way to get past the Pioneer’s crew!
Over there, on the wall. Is that... writing?
Good eye, Doctor. I nearly missed it in the darkness.
“My eyes are not my own…”. I can't make out that particular word.
“In this valley of dying stars. Oh hollow. Oh emp-“. It trails off into unintelligible drivel…
A warning, perhaps?
I'm not sure they even knew what was happening to them. This illness seems to eat away at whomever is infected.
Have you noticed a common thread in all our encounters in the Nexus?
I was just thinking that, Michael.
We keep meeting individuals – even machines – overcome by an outside influence.
Yes. Infected, diseased, malfunctioning, assimilated. A coincidence?
Or perhaps a pattern in all this Nexus chaos…

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It appears to be a Starfleet officer. Possibly the former Captain of this ship.
Is he conscious, Doctor? Is he able to speak?
Hold your horses. His life signs are stable, which is a good start.
I’m administering a stimulant!
Who? Wh-where am I?
Woah there. Take it easy, man! You're with friends – we’re of the U.S.S. Artemis. Can you tell me your name?
I... I'm Benjamin Sisko. Acting Captain of the U.S.S. Pioneer.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Someone is lying on the bed there!
He must be the one drawing the infected!
What should we do about them?.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

missions.locDescription: The U.S.S. Artemis finds a lone Starfleet vessel, the U.S.S. Pioneer, adrift and unresponsive.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission2

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: How’s our patient, Doctor?
As far as I can tell, Captain Sisko’s fine. Scans show no signs of physical or mental trauma.
Listen, Captain, we're here to help. Can you tell us what happened to you?
I... I'm not sure, Doctor. Everything feels blurry. Soft somehow.
I remember a gathering somewhere in space. Maybe some kind of reception? I was speaking to a Klingon, and then there was a commotion.
Doctor, but we have company!
We’re cornered inside the Sickbay. More of them will be coming.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Maddening alien noise*
That sound… that’s what people on the ship sounded like as they were being infected!
It was terrible. I heard them crying out, then their voices turned low and guttural.
Here they come!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I... I remember running down this corridor before.
Do you recall what you were doing?
I was... I was looking down at myself. I... I know that doesn't make any sense.
It was as if I was outside my body, watching myself run. It was chaos, crew everywhere. People struggling and shouting.
I was myself, and then… it was as if I was sharing my body with something else.
I'm sorry you had to go through something so terrifying, Captain.
Thank you, Doctor. Please, let’s keep going.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Does this door here lead to the bridge?
To the crew's quarters. Perhaps more of my people have taken shelter in there!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The turbolift should be straight ahead.
Along with what looks like half of your crew! They’re clustered around it.
We must get past them if we want to retake the bridge. Follow me!
I commend your enthusiasm, Captain!
They're retreating, but it looks like the controls have been damaged.
With the shields still up, the Artemis won't be able to beam us directly to the bridge.
Well, we're going to need a new plan. Suggestions?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: No! No! Stay back! Stay… aghhhhhh!
Over there! That’s my first officer!
*alien scream*
My god. That poor devil’s already been corrupted. This virus is unlike anything I've ever seen before!
We can try and treat her later, Doctor. For now, we need to stay alive!
On my left! Drive them away from the controls!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The infected are everywhere! Look out!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We should be safe to search through the logs now.
Captain's Log. Stardat-... *crackle*. En route to the *crackle* system with the delegates.
I'm confident my gift of Klingon bloodw- *crackle* will go down well with Ambassador Martok.
There are not entries for 27 hours following that. And then this…
*crackle* -omething has gone wrong. Cardassians are gone. We're retreati- *crackle* -endezvous with Martok's Bird of Prey in the Kurtz system. I hope w-*crackle*
They're with us. It's inside the ship. Inside us. I think I might be infected. I see colors out of the corner of my eye.
Strange colors. *crackle* Look alien in the mirror. I don't recognize my own fa- *crackle*
And that’s all I could find. What happened to you out there, Captain?
I wish I could remember!

missions.locName: THE LOG OF THE U.S.S. PIONEER
missions.locDescription: The U.S.S. Pioneer's crew have succumbed to a form of madness that renders them confused and highly aggressive.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission3

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Well, we're here. Now what?
Whatever we do, we must proceed cautiously. I'm picking up damage throughout the ship.
Serious damage... It looked like firefights broke out throughout the decks.
And here I assumed it was just part of the decor.
Hold up. I'm receiving a message on comms.
But he’s rather well versed in it. Hold up. I'm receiving a message on comms.
-is commander Martok. Can anyone hear me?
This is Michael Burnham of the U.S.S. Artemis. We are standing by to aid you. Where are you?
Starfleet? On my ship? Wanting to help me? Bah, the ancestors of my house will be cursing me from their graves!
I'm holed up on the bridge. Come and find me before I regret accepting your hel- *crackle*
He cut off. Let’s head to the bridge!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *alien ramblings*
Klingons over there, on the starboard side!
They sound just like the crew of the Pioneer. Whatever they're saying, it's not Klingon.
I think Doctor McCoy was right earlier: there’s no pattern in their utterings that would suggest a cohesive language.
It's like they're as alien to each other as they are to us, struggling to communicate but not sure how.
Let’s stop them killing each other, and then we can discuss the finer points of their dialect!
We're officially lost.
A Klingon is never lost in a Bird of Prey, Doctor.
By all means, take the lead.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: It looks like we're not the first to make a stand here. This part of the ship is so damaged, it's a wonder there's anything left!
Ahead of us!
Concentrate your fire! They're shrugging off all but the heaviest of shots.
They've lost all sense of self-preservation! They're just charging straight towards us!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hold. Scans are detecting a breach in the corridor ahead.
Someone must have detonated something powerful enough to punch a hole right through the hull of the ship!
Well, this is a fine mess. I don't suppose anyone’s got an EV suit handy?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *crackle* Can anyone hear me? You still with me, Federation whelp?
I'm reading you. Martok. What's your status?
I’m on the bridge. I'm safe for now, but those treacherous dogs have found me.
It’s only a matter of time before they break in here!
We're en route! Are you still able to fight?
Bah... I'm a Klingon, boy. We're born abl- *crackle*
I've lost communications. We need to hurry!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the ship's Sickbay.
More bodies. How horrific.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: That's the Bridge.
Push through!
Can you hear me, Federation? They've breached the doors. Today IS a good day to die! *crackle*
Captain? Captain?! We need to get in there immediately!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hah! I THOUGHT one of you sounded like a Klingon. Come in and join the battle!
Forward! Jagh yIbuStaH!
I assume that means something… inspirational?

missions.locDescription: Long-ranged scans have revealed a badly damaged Warbird tumbling through space: the I.K.S. Ning'Tao.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission4

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The atmosphere seems breathable, but I'm not sure it will last.
I'm reading structural damage across the entire ship.
Similar to the damage inflicted by the crews on the other vessels?
Oddly, no. This vessel has suffered damage on what appears to be a molecular level. It’s almost as if the entire ship is drifting apart!
That may account for the spikes of radiation I’m reading across the ship; my guess is the erosion is causing the warp core to fail.
We must get to the engine room and stabilize it somehow.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Those Cardassian crew members are clearly possessed.
*alien whispering*
If Martok was right, this must be the source of the infection.
There are too many of them!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The shields are holding most of them back.
We need to subdue them before the barrier collapses.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Cardassian language*
And now the ship's yelling at us. Charming. Any idea what it’s saying?
Give the universal translator a moment to adjust.
Warp core critical failure imminent. All crew with security clearance proceed immediately to the officer shuttles for evacuation.
Sorry I asked.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Hmmm. Fewer than I expected.
Were you hoping for more?!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's more of them coming from every direction. If we don't do something, we'll be overrun!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This must be the engine room.
Or what's left of it! We need to find a way to shut down the power before it destroys the ship!
*Alien tongue*!
Critical failure imminent. Prepare for incineration.
High Command thanks you for your futile but heroic deaths. Long live the Empir- *crackle*
... ... is that thing playing music?!
I believe that is the Cardassian anthem.
Catchy tune. We should hurry, if only to shut this thing up.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The Bridge should be right ahead of us.
Looks empty except for... is that Dukat?!
It’s Gul Dukat to you! Who are you and how dare you set foot on my ship!
That’s Dukat, all right. A different Nexus version of him, but with the same delightful attitude.

missions.locDescription: Above the planet floats the Cardassian ship Martok warned you about. The Kornaire.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission5

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Cardassians! It must be the remnants of their scouting team!
Stay back. We can't let them infect us.
Woah. That was... unusual.
That was odd. Is everyone all right?
That looks like a temporary camp just over there. Probably erected by the Cardassian landing.
We should reach it and investigate.
Although… this is odd. I'm picking up a strong signal from the east, past those dunes.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This was the Cardassian camp, alright. Or what's left of it.
I'm not picking up any life signs. Whatever happened here was days ago.
Let’s spread out.

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Human and Cardassian life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *Alien tongue*
Klingons? Here?
Maybe members of the Klingon delegation? Some of them could have escaped the disaster in shuttles...
…fled to the only nearby planet…
Out of the frying pan and into the fire!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: *alien language*
Oh, you have to be joking. Who else is on this planet?!
I suggest we don't stay long enough to find out, Doctor!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Have you ever seen anything like this before?
Never. This is eons beyond any recorded technology.
It looks a lot like the Reactors we've been finding.
We may be looking at the machine behind the Nexus. This could be the construct powering each of the realities we had been to.
The message from earlier said the construct is under attack… so as the reality around this “construct” collapses, we're able to see the gears turning…
Exactly!

encounter.locDescription: Hostile Human and Klingon life signs detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm picking up something moving towards us.
From which direction, Mr. Worf?
Impossible to say. I'm reading 2... 3... multiple signatures, all converging on our location!
*alien howl*
More and more of the Nexus machinery.
It’s more significant in size than I first thought.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Wait. The energy signatures are spiking.
More of those creatures everywhere!

missions.locDescription: Beaming down to the surface of the planet to find the source of this madness.

missions.name: Data_GSMissions_displayName_Episode6_Mission6

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: The signal we tracked earlier is stronger here. I think it’s communicating directly with us!
Adapting to sub language x-345b. Time period Beta Epsilon 56. Region. Outer Spiral of Galaxy 5b67y. Colloquially known as “the Milky Way”.
Query. Data shows possession of five Cores. Possession indicates potential Engineer capabilities.
The Reactors? Yes! We've found five of them, like you say. Who are we speaking to?
Caretaker 689b-epsilon. Charged with preservation and operation of Reality Engine and associ-*crackle* -pheres.
Where are we?
You ar- *crackle* -ently in the Nexus, in Sphere Construct 789.341.b12.
What do you mean by “Sphere”?
Spher- *crackle* -irtual realities constructed around the consciousness to ensure condition of bliss.
I've lost contact. The signal seems to be deteriorating further.
This is fascinating! The Nexus was constructed with the intent to create these “blissful” dream worlds we had heard about.
So, where did it go wrong? Since we've set foot in the Nexus, it’s all been doom and gloom.
This whole “machine” appears to be breaking down. The realities we’ve visited, the “madness” in the crews we've come across – it all must be part of it.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Energy spikes in front of us.
More of those things are rising out of the sand!

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: There's rubble everywhere. I can't tell if this is an actual path anymore.
*crackle* -pologies for error in communication. Sphere cohesion at 36% and falling.
Where are we? What is this place?
You are in - as species in your sector classify it - the Nexus.
Can you be more specific?
Of c-... c-... cours- *crackle* This dimension is a repository designed to eliminat- *crackle* -e trauma that connects all life.
Trauma? I don't understand.
The Nexus eliminates pain, strife and death. Each consciousness that enters it is hosted within a dedicated Sphere, providing it eternal bliss.
It’s describing heaven. An artificially-created heaven...

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of them coming!

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I had no concept of the scale or age of this place. That do-hickey mentioned trillions of souls resting inside the Nexus.
And if it's beginning to collapse, every one of them is at risk!
I suggest we start with a full analysis of this technology. Hopefully, it will provide more information on the workings of the Nexus.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of those things. An entire horde of them just standing there like watchdogs.
It's impossible to advance without them noticing us.
Damage to this and nearby Spheres have impacted my abil- *crackle* -unction properly. Code decaying and affecting operation parameters.
What’s the source of this damage?
A flaw within the Nexus caused the fatal collapse of a Sphere approximately 12,356 of your earth cycles ago.
That flaw has now spread, corrupt- *crackle* -estroying 19% of all known spheres.
Wait, didn't it say earlier each “consciousness” that enters the Nexus is hosted in its own dedicated Sphere?
What happened to all those poor souls?
As of this moment, approximately 38,007,684,112 consciousnesses had been extinguished du- *crackle* -flaw.
That is horrendous. What's this flaw?
It’s no good. I've lost communication again.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I've found some containers. They appear Cardassian in design.
Supplies left behind...

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.
Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: More of those things.
They're gunning for us.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: We're being overwhelmed.
Things are swarming like bees to honey.

encounter.locDescription: Unknown hostiles detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Warning! Spher- *crackle* -tegrity terminally compromised. Flaw approach- *crackle*
Well, that doesn't sound good!
Sphere cohesion at .03% Flee enginee- *crackle* -se the reacto- *crackle* -epair the Engi… EEEEEEEEEEEEEE *crackle*
The signal just died. I fear it’s been destroyed.
That’s not all. This light around us – the same when we were with Kirk and the Gorn! Something’s appearing!
Hello.
Identify yourself!
My name is... it’s been long forgotten. When one spends enough time in this place, memories tend to... decay. And I've been in here for a very, VERY long time.
This machine referred to you as a “flaw”.
Did it? A dreary term from an even drearier machine. I am one of the Dreamless, the closest analogue in your language.
Now, I must demand the Reactor you're holding. I'd prefer you surrender it, but I won't hesitate to take it by force.

missions.locName: NOT WITH A BANG BUT A WHIMPER
missions.locDescription: To boldly go where no one has gone before.
